title: Mutton Tandoori Roast Recipe
method: 1. To start with the recipe, you first need to marinate the mutton pieces. Take a large mixing bowl, add yogurt, ginger garlic paste, red chilli powder, tandoori masala, and mustard oil. Mix these ingredients properly.
2. Now add mutton pieces in the marinade and make sure the mutton pieces are well coated. Keep them in the fridge for about 15-20 mins.
3. Once done, grill the pieces in the BBQ grill and enjoy! Now, if you do not have a BBQ grill at home, spread the pieces on a baking tray.
4. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 C for 20-30 mins.
5. Once done, spread butter and enjoy!

title: Egg Pomfret/ Anda Paplet Recipe
method: 1. This recipe requires the preparation of three things – egg keema, omelette, and egg gravy.
2. Heat butter and oil in a pan, sautee crushed black pepper, cumin seeds, chopped onion, garam masala and chopped, boiled egg whites.
3. Prepare a green paste using coriander leaves and ginger.
4. Pour the paste in the egg whites and squeeze lemon juice. The egg keema is ready.
5. Prepare an omelette with whole eggs, pepper powder, cumin powder, red chilli powder and salt.
6. Once the omelette is ready, stuff it in egg keema and place it in a plate.
7. In the same pan, heat more oil and butter. Sautee peppercorns, cumin seeds, onion paste, garlic, ginger and tomato paste.
8. Add grated egg whites from the boiled egg used to make the egg keema.
9. Season it with red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala and salt.
10. Pour water and cook it till the gravy thickens.
11. Place the gravy in the omelette plate. The anda pomfret is ready!

title: Payyoli Chicken Fry Recipe

ingredient.description: Gram Chicken, cleaned and cut into 1 inch cubes

method: 1. Marinate the chicken in minced ginger and garlic, vinegar, turmeric powder, salt, meat masala powder and Kashmiri red chilli powder. Keep this for an hour.
2. Combine grated coconut and Kashmiri red chilli powder.
3. Heat coconut oil in a pan and fry the marinated chicken along with slit green chillies.
4. Add the red chilli-coconut mix and curry leaves to the semi-cooked chicken and fry it for a while.
5. Pour water and let the chicken cook till the chicken completely absorbs the water.
6. The Payyoli chicken fry is ready!

title: Restaurant-Style Dragon Chicken Recipe
method: 1. For the marinade: Add all the ingredients into a bowl. Mix well and set aside. Make sure there are no lumps.
2. Heat oil in a pan, for shallow frying the marinated chicken strips.
3. Now, add one chicken strip at a time and allow them to fry on medium heat until golden brown.
4. For the stir fry: Heat oil in a wok on high heat. Add garlic and red chilli paste. Fry on high heat for 1-2 mins.
5. Add onion, capsicum and sautee well.
6. Add vinegar, soy sauce, ketchup and salt. Mix well.
7. In a separate bowl, combine corn flour and water. Add it to the wok. Cook until the sauce thickens.
8. Add fried chicken strips and toss to combine. Top it with spring onions and cashews. Serve hot and enjoy!

title: Chicken Chilli Gravy Recipe
method: 1. For Marination: Take a large mixing bowl, add chicken chunks along with all the dry ingredients and soya sauce, ginger garlic paste, egg, corn flour, all-purpose flour. Mix well by using hands.
2. Set aside for 15-20 minutes.
3. For Gravy: Heat oil in a pan and deep fry all the chicken chunks. Keep aside. Now in the same pan, reduce the oil and Sautee ginger garlic paste.
4. Then add veggies like capsicum, onion and green chillies. Sautee again for about 2-3 minutes on medium flame.
5. Now lower the flame and corn flour slurry to make the gravy thick and consistent. Now, add all the sauces.
6. Stir it and give it a boil. Ps: You can add more water if you need extra gravy. Now, add fried chicken and mix everything well. Sprinkle spring onions and coriander leaves.
7. Serve and enjoy!

title: Rose & Litchi Ganache Butter Cookies Recipe
method: 1. Cream the butter and powdered sugar till it gets white and fluffy.
2. Now add the milk and mix it.
3. Add in the flour, salt, and baking soda and mix it.
4. Now make small balls of the dough and place them on a baking tray.
5. Bake it in a preheated oven at 180 degrees for 15-20 mins
1. Heat cream and pour it on the white chocolate and let it rest for 2 min.
2. Once the chocolate is melted, mix the cream and chocolate.
3. Add in the litchi pulp and rose extract and mix it well.
4. Let it refrigerate for 1 hour.
5. Once it is cooled, pipe it between the cookies and serve.

title: Grilled Lobster Rolls With Apple And Cabbage Slaw Recipe
method: 1. Preheat a pan until really hot.
2. Butter the rolls on both sides and grill on both sides until toasted and lightly charred.
3. Trim and chop the celery, chop the lobster meat in chunks and combine with the mayonnaise. Season with sea salt and black pepper to taste.
4. Open warm grilled buns and top with the lobster mixture.
1. Finely shred the purple cabbage.
2. Cut the green apple in fine juliennes.
3. Combine cabbage and apple with the mayonnaise. Season with sea salt and black pepper to taste.
4. Place the slaw on top of the lobster roll serve along with French fries.

title: Mango Chilli Chicken Recipe
method: 1. To begin with the recipe, you first need to coat the boneless chicken chunks. For this, take a bowl, add all-purpose flour, corn flour, salt, black pepper and ginger-garlic paste and mix well. Add the cubed chicken to the bowl and coat them nicely with the flour mixture. Keep aside.

2. Meanwhile, take a frying pan, add oil and heat it. Once done, drop the chicken pieces and fry until golden brown and crisp. Please Note: If you want extra crispy chicken, then you can double fry the chicken pieces.
3. Now for the sauce, take a separate pan, add 2 tbsp oil and let it heat. Add chopped green chillies and chopped garlic and fry for a few seconds.
4. Add onion (cubed) and cubed mixed bell peppers and fry on high heat for a minute.
5. Now is the time to add soya sauce, sweet chili sauce (optional), red chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, salt to taste, and ½ teaspoon ground black pepper to the wok.
6. Mix cornstarch in 1/2 cup water to make a slurry and add it to the wok. Cook for a minute or till the sauce thicken and the cornstarch is cooked. Add more water if required.
7. Add the fried chicken and mango pulp and give it a mix.
8. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
9. Serve and enjoy!

title: Mango Phalsa Chaat Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl combine diced mangoes with honey, salt, mint, chaat masala, lemon juice and chilli flakes.
2. Toss gently to mix all ingredients well.
3. Transfer to a serving glass and put phalsa berries all over the chaat. Garnish with mint sprig.
4. Serve and enjoy!

title: Bhuna Paneer Roll Recipe
method: 1. Preheat the oven to 220 degrees Celsius.

1. In a large bowl, add all the dry spice powders, ginger-garlic paste, mustard oil, lime juice, both the salts and hung yogurt. Mix well. Add the paneer and onion to the marinade and make sure they are coated well.

2. Switch on the grill in the oven, and thread the marinated pieces of paneer on a skewer, alternating with onions. Then, place the skewers on a baking tray or balance the skewers on the edges of the baking tray so that the paneer does not touch the surface of the tray.
3. Place the tray under the grill till the paneer is charred. Use a fork to transfer the paneer from the skewers into a bowl.

4. Alternatively, you can also heat a thick-bottomed pan, a griddle pan or a cast iron pan and place the marinated pieces of paneer on it, making sure there is space between each piece. Cook on high heat till the paneer is charred. Then, using a flat spatula, transfer them to a plate or a bowl.
5. While the paneer is being grilled, prepare the chutney. Add all the ingredients for the chutney to a blender jar and blitz it up. Transfer to a bowl until required.

1. Heat a tawa and place a roti or paratha on the pan and warm it roughly for a minute on each side. Place the paratha on a plate, arrange the pieces of paneer and onion in the centre and drizzle with the green chutney.
2. Fold to close it, and for the ease of eating, wrap the bottom half of the roll in foil.
3. Enjoy!

title: Chicago Deep Dish Pizza Recipe

ingredient.description: Half a medium bell pepper, thinly sliced

method: 1. In a bowl, crush the tomatoes to a mildly chunky texture using a masher. You can optionally use a hand blender but be careful not to blend too long or you will lose a lot of texture from the sauce.

2. Add the garlic, salt and olive oil to the tomatoes and mix. Taste and add more salt if desired. If the sauce is too tangy, add sugar while tasting to balance out the natural acidity of the tomatoes.
3. Optionally, tear up some basil leaves by hand and mix them into the sauce.
4. Prepare the pizza dough ahead of time, at least 2 hours before you want to start cooking your pizza. In a mixing bowl, add the flour, cornmeal, yeast, sugar and salt.
5. Place two-thirds of the water in a large bowl. Bring the other third of water to boil, then add it to the cold water in the bowl. This creates the correct temperature for activating yeast.

6. Add the water and oil to the mixing bowl, and mix all the ingredients together with either a spoon or an electric dough mixer until the flour is completely absorbed, then continue kneading for 5 minutes. The dough will be ready when it’s smooth and slightly sticky – it will pull away from the sides of the bowl, but stick to the bottom of the bowl.

7. Grease a medium bowl with the tablespoon of melted butter. Transfer the dough to the bowl and turn the dough over to coat it in the butter. Cover the bowl and leave the dough to rise at room temperature for 2 hours, or until it’s doubled in size.
8. In a pan over a medium heat, add a tablespoon of the olive oil. Sweat the onion and bell pepper until softened, then add the sausage and sauté until cooked. Set aside.
9. Fire up your pizza oven. Aim for a temperature of 260˚C at the center of the baking stone inside. You can check the temperature quickly and easily using an infrared thermometer.

10. Divide the dough in half. Grease your Cast Iron Skillet with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and press the dough into the bottom and up the sides of the skillet. Leave the dough to rest for 10 minutes.
11. Layer on the toppings, starting with the mozzarella, then the sausage, onion, and bell pepper mixture, and finally an even layer of the pizza sauce.

12. Place the skillet in the back of the oven for 5 minutes, until the top is golden, and the crust is evenly browned, turning halfway through the bake. Move the skillet to the front of the oven and continue baking for another 20 minutes, rotating every few minutes. If the top of the crust looks like it’s browning too fast, turn off the oven, push the skillet to the middle of the oven to continue baking the pizza in the residual heat. The pizza is cooked when you can easily lift up the crust using tongs.

13. Remove the skillet from the oven and let the pizza rest for 5 minutes. To serve, you can either slice it inside the skillet, or pull it out onto a serving board to slice – and enjoy all that saucy, cheesy goodness!

title: Oats Appe Recipe
method: 1. Take soaked urad dal and grind it till smooth.
2. To this add powdered oats with salt, red chilli powder and pepper.
3. Mix this and add chopped onion, carrot and capsicum. Combine this well.
4. Then take the appa maker and grease it.
5. Drop spoonful of this batter in the greased pan and let it cook.
6. Then flip and cook from other side. Once brown and crisp, take it out and serve!

title: Street Style Egg Masala Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. First of all, heat oil in a pan, add cumin, onion and ginger garlic paste and fry for some time.
2. Add tomatoes and fry for some time. Add green chillies, red chillies, coriander powder, black pepper and salt to it and mix well.
3. Add boiled chopped eggs and mix and switch off the gas.
4. Take bread slices, spread butter and green chutney on both the slices. Apply a layer of red chutney, place the egg mixture on it.
5. Place it on another bread, heat the pan on the gas, add butter and fry the sandwich from both the sides till it becomes crispy.

title: Stuffed Makhmali Chicken Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Mix cream, curd, onion powder, green chili paste, ginger paste, coriander powder, salt, cumin powder, black pepper, cumin powder and roasted gram flour in a bowl.
2. Add chicken pieces to it and let it marinate for 30 minutes.
3. Meanwhile prepare the stuffing. Mix the things mentioned above.
4. Grind the chicken and place the stuffing on it, roll it and put it in the square with capsicum.
5. Put a little oil in a pan and fry it by rotating it from all sides.
6. Serve with favorite chutney.

title: Tandoori Aloo Keema Recipe
method: 1. In a pan add oil, bay leaf, green cardamom, zeera and cloves. Now add chopped onions. Saute till golden brown.
2. Add garlic, ginger and butter. Next, add the green chillies and capsicum.
3. Now add the masalas: turmeric powder, red chilli powder, zeera powder, dhaniya powder, hing and salt.
4. Add the mutton mince and let it cook for about 5 minutes. Now, throw in chopped potatoes and tomatoes.
5. Once done, garnish with coriander leaves and serve!

title: Mutton Vadai Recipe
method: 1. To begin with the recipe, you first need to take a large mixing bowl. Mix fennel seeds, chana dal, cumin seeds and green chillies in it.
2. Now, add water to the bowl and soak the dal for about 45 mins. After that, drain the excess water. In a grinder, grind the dal into a coarse paste.
3. Take minced meat and put it in the grinder to make a thick paste. Take a bowl and add gram flour, asafoetida and garam masala in it.
4. In a seperate bowl, mix curry leaves, chopped onions, coriander leaves, ginger-garlic paste and salt. Now combine all the ingredients together in one large bowl.
5. Form the mix into small balls and flatten them to give them the shape of vadai.
6. Take a deep frying pan and heat oil in it. Fry the vadai in the pan until they turn golden brown in colour.
7. Drain the excess oil and dry the cutlets by using tissues.
8. Serve and enjoy!

title: Bread Pakora Chaat Recipe
method: 1. To make the potatoes filling, take a bowl, add boiled potatoes, green chillies, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala.
2. Mash the potatoes perfectly.
3. Now stuff two slice of bread with potato filling.
4. For batter, take a bowl, add besan, salt and water. Mix everything. Ps: make sure the batter is thick.
5. Now dip stuffed bread slices in the batter and deep fry them until golden.
6. Cut the fried bread pakora in 4 equal parts. Place in a plate and pour both chutneys along with curd.
7. Sprinkle sev, pomegranate kernels, coriander leaves and chaat masala on top it
8. Repeat the same process with the remaining bread pakoda.
9. Serve and enjoy!

title: Mint Chicken Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl, first add hung curd, ginger garlic paste, green chili paste, all spices, salt and one teaspoon oil.
2. Mix all the things well and add boneless chicken pieces to it, mix well and keep it in the fridge to marinate for some time.
3. Place all the chicken pieces in the skewer. Now put oil on the grill pan and heat it.
4. Set the prepared skewers in it and grill the chicken pieces while rotating them from all sides.
5. When the chicken pieces are completely soft and cooked, then serve them in the serving plate with favorite chutney.

title: Minced Chicken Lollipop Recipe
method: 1. First of all, take boneless chicken in a mixer jar. Add ginger, garlic cloves and green chillies to it and blend it smooth.
2. Take out this mixture in a bowl, now add cornflour, salt, black pepper, green coriander, red chili, coriander and cumin powder, mix everything well and keep the mixture aside.
3. Take all purpose flour in a bowl, add water and prepare a thin batter. Also keep the oil on the gas for heating.
4. Grease your hands with oil and start making lollipops from the mixture. Make a lollipop shape by placing an ice cream stick in the middle.
5. Now lift each piece and dip it in the batter and once again coat it in bread crumbs.
6. If you want, you can also keep them in the fridge to set for some time. Or you can fry it immediately.
7. Deep fry them till they become crispy and golden brown and serve with favorite chutney or dip.

title: Chicken Seekh Kebab Roll Recipe
method: 1. Take a large mixing bowl, add chicken keema along with all the spices, chopped onion and cilantro.
2. Mix well and set aside for 10-15 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, make roll sheets. Knead a dough by using all purpose flour, salt and water. Set aside.

4. To form the kebabs around the skewer, squeeze portion around the skewer. Using the your fingers as a guide, squeeze and gently spread the meat along the length of the skewer. If the meat is sticking, you can apple a bit of water or oil to your hands.
5. Heat a pan on medium heat and add 1-2 Tbsp ghee or oil. Form your kebab using your hands until it resembles a sausage. When the pan gets hot, add the kebabs onto the pan.
6. Wait until all the kebabs turn golden.
7. Once done, take a small portion from the dough, roll it like chapati.
8. Heat your tawa pan until the pan is hot, then add the rolled out dough onto the pan.
9. Cook from both sides.
1. Spread the cilantro-mint chutney on both parathas.

2. Now add the seekh kebabs, sliced onions and tomatoes to the centre of the bread and start wrapping the paratha. After folding the bread in half, tuck and seal once end of the roll and wrap the bread tightly all the way.
3. Serve it with more green chutney and onion rings.

title: No Oven Garlic Bread Recipe
method: 1. First of all, dissolve sugar in a quarter cup of lukewarm water, add yeast to it and mix it and keep it aside for some time.
2. Now take all purpose flour in a big bowl, add salt, garlic powder and oregano and mix it.
3. In this time the yeast will become fluffy, add it to the maida and mix it and knead a soft dough. Pour some oil on the dough and once again knead it and keep it aside.
4. The flour will get ready in 15 minutes. Grease your hands with oil and knead it again.
5. Now take out a portion from the dough, sprinkle some all purpose flour and roll it into a circular shape. Add cheese and boiled corn to one side.
6. Apply oil on the edge and fold its other side. Apply a lot of butter on it with the help of a brush.
7. Sprinkle oregano, chili flakes and garlic powder on it and make light cuts.
8. Turn on the gas and place a pan on it. Put salt in the pan and heat it, keep a bowl or stand in the middle of it.
9. Place the prepared garlic bread on a baking tray and place it in a pan to be baked.
10. After placing the baking tray in the pan, put a lid on it and let it bake for 15 minutes. After this take out the baking tray and serve sliced.

title: Reshmi Chicken Paratha Roll Recipe
method: 1. Blend cashews and sesame seeds in a blender. Now add green chillies, ginger, garlic buds, cream and curd to it and make a smooth paste.
2. Take boneless chicken in a bowl and add the prepared paste, red pepper, black pepper, coriander, cumin powder and salt and mix all the things well with the chicken.
3. Let the chicken marinate for 15 to 20 minutes. Till the time the chicken is getting marinated, knead it and make parathas.
4. After this, heat 2 to 3 tablespoons of oil in a pan and put the marinated chicken in it and start cooking.
5. When the chicken starts cooking, add chopped onion to it. When the chicken is completely cooked, switch off the gas.
6. Take paratha, spread mayonnaise on it, add prepared chicken and now prepare rolls by pouring green chutney on it.

title: Fish Popcorn Recipe
method: 1. You need to first wash fish pieces. Cut into cubes, preferably. Pat dry with a towel.
2. Add red chilli powder, garlic powder and salt along with pepper.
3. Mix it nicely to coat the fish.
4. Prepare flour mix, add some seasonings and water.
5. Crack one egg and add little salt and pepper and mix it nicely.
6. First dip the fish pieces into the batter and then dip in eggs. Later coat them in breadcrumbs.
7. Repeat the same with every pieces.
8. Deep fry all the pieces until golden.

title: Bite-Size Chicken Balls Recipe
method: 1. Take shredded boiled chicken in a bowl. Add all the spices and boiled mashed boiled potatoes to it and mix it well.
2. Add bread crumbs cornflour, all purpose flour, salt and pepper and mix.
3. Now make small balls from the mixture and keep aside. Dip the balls in the beaten egg and coat them in bread crumbs.
4. After this, heat oil in a pan and deep fry all these balls till they become crispy golden.
5. Serve with favorite dip or chutney.

title: Mexican Chicken Nachos Recipe

ingredient.description: Kilograms Boneless and Skinless Chicken (Mix of breast and thigh meat)
(Cut into long thin slices like ¾ inch) Green pepper
(Cut into long thin slices like ¾ inch) Yellow pepper
(Cut into long thin slices like ¾ inch) Red pepper
or 3 (Cut into circular thin slices) Jalapenos
Mexican Cheese – More the better according to your love for cheese
and a half tsp Red Chilli Powder
tsp to 1 ½ tsp (According to your spice level) Black pepper powder

method: 1. Massage all the ingredients mentioned under marination list with the chicken.
2. Take 12 inches pan and put some oil and heat it up.
3. Add the marinated boneless chicken and cook it without closing the lid.
4. Let the juices from the chicken ooze out after 10 minutes of cooking and keep stirring the chicken occasionally so it doesn’t burn.
5. Chicken should be ready within 30 min.utes of cooking.
6. Taste the salt and add accordingly towards the end if needed
1. Take a square size aluminum pan as shown in the attached picture. Braise the pan with oil.
2. Put a layer of Tortilla chips. Top it with Onions, green peppers, red peppers, yellow peppers, black beans, cooked chicken and Jalapenos.
3. Add generous amount of Mexican Cheese.
4. Repeat the process of the above layering like 3 or 4 times based on the size of the pan and your available ingredients and cooked chicken.
1. Pre-heat the oven to 180 C. Put the square pan in the oven and bake it for 18 – 20 minutes and the final dish is ready !

title: Street Style Fried Chicken (Wings) Kebab Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half tsp Cumin Seeds
tsp Salt (A pinch more for final seasoning)
tbsp Chopped/ crushed Ginger and Garlic (Optional)
tbsp Self Raising Flour (Or ½ Tsp of Baking Powder with a Tbsp of Plain Flour)

method: 1. Toast 1 Tsp of cumin (save the rest for later), black pepper, fenugreek and about 10-15 curry leaves in a medium pan, until the curry leaves dry out and the spice blend is fragrant.
2. Crush these spices into a powder and keep aside.
3. Take the chicken wings and add 1 Tsp of salt, ½ Tsp Cumin, the spice blend from the previous step, Kashmiri red chilli powder, coriander powder, lemon juice, ginger, garlic and oil. Mix well.
4. Marinate the wings for at least 2 hours or overnight, for best results.
5. Add the corn flour, self raising flour, egg to the marinated wings. Mix well, until a light batter like consistency is formed. Keep aside for 30-45 mins.
6. Heat oil in a medium saucepan or a Kadai.
7. Fry the wings, 2-3 at a time, DO NOT OVERCROWD the saucepan/ kadai.
8. Fry for several minutes on a medium flame and evenly, the chicken needs to cook through and turn lightly golden.
9. Take out the chicken and place it on a paper towel.
10. Finish frying off the entire batch and keep the fried wings aside. Skim the oil in the pan and bring it up to a high temperature (about 175 Degrees).
11. Fry the wings again (Twice Fried) for 2-4 minutes, or until the batter looks a bit more brown. Avoid burning the wings.
12. Season the wings with a pinch of salt, and serve with Chutneys, a wedge of Lemon and some Beer.

title: Chana Dal Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, prepare the batter. Rinse the chana dal and soak it in a bowl for an hour.
2. After an hour, drain the water and put the dal in the pressure cooker with garlic, ginger, green chilies and 1 cup of water and pressure cook them for 3 whistles.
3. Once done, turn off the flame. Then, add the pressure cooked ingredients, spinach, and the green peas to the blender with a little water. Blend them into a smooth paste.
4. Now is the time to transfer this blended paste to a large mixing bowl and add the paneer, salt, garam masala, chaat masala and 1/2 cup of bread crumbs to it. Mix well.
5. Now take a small amount to make tikki-like structure. Roll it on your palms.
6. Prepare a flour- water paste in a bowl using the all purpose flour and water. Spread the remaining bread crumbs in a plate.
7. Heat the refined oil in a kadhai over a medium flame. Now, first dip the kebabs in the flour- water mixture and then roll them in the breadcrumbs.
8. Next, deep fry the kebabs until they turn golden brown from both the sides. Take them out of the kadhai and drain the excess oil using the clean paper towels.
9. Serve and enjoy!!

title: Butter Chicken Kulcha Recipe
method: 1. In a pan add roast onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic and some cashews. Once that is done, take it out and blend to make a sauce.
2. Pour this in a kadhai with some oil and let it come to a boil.
3. Throw in the chicken pieces in it with required spices. Once that is done, keep it aside.
4. Now, take a pan and add some butter on it.
5. Place a kulcha and put the chicken pieces on top of it.
6. Now place another kulcha from the top. Flip it and cook from the other side.
7. Before serving cut it in two equal parts and serve.

title: Stuffed Bombile Recipe
method: 1. Clean the bombile then slit and take out the middle bone.
2. Then marinate with salt and lime juice, keep a side at least one hour.
3. Take out all the water from Bombile.
4. Same time make a stuffing with help of above ingredients (coconut, curry leaves, chili, fresh coriander, and ginger, garlic).
5. Then tap bombile with tissue paper, make it dry then fill the stuffing inside.
6. Heat the pan, add oil then make mixture of rice flour, semolina and deghi mirch.
7. Then stuff bombile, coat it with rice flour and semolina mixture then shallow fry.
8. Serve with mint chutney.

title: Kolim Wade Recipe

ingredient.description: nos Chopped spring onion with white and green both

method: 1. Firstly, wash and clean the kolim (baby shrimps) properly.
2. Then add all the ingredients mentioned above.
3. Mix it very well.
4. Then make a tikki , then seared on a pan both side.
5. Served with mint chutney

title: Chicken Potato Kebab Recipe
method: 1. First take a mixing bowl, add boiled potatoes, and mash them properly. Now add shredded boiled chicken along with garam masala, salt, roasted jeera powder, kaali mirch, ginger garlic paste, mint leaves, soya sauce and coriander leaves.
2. Once done mixing, add chopped green chillies and mash everything again. Refrigerate for 10-15 mins.
3. Now, take small portions from the mixture, roll it out and form a tikki like structure.
4. Dip the tikki into the beaten egg batter then coat it with breadcrumbs.
5. Repeat the same with remained kebab mixture.
6. Deep fry all the tikkis and your kebabs are ready
7. Serve and enjoy!

title: Egg Puff Recipe

ingredient.description: tsp Red chilli powder ( or to taste)
tbsp Sunflower oil plus extra for brushing

method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. They will start to splutter.
2. Turn the hob to medium heat and add sliced onions and saute them till soft.
3. Add chopped tomatoes to this and saute till they are soft.
4. Lower the heat again, add the dry powders and saute till they release their oils and you can smell a wonderful aroma. Remove from heat. Your masala mix is ready.

5. Prepare the puff pastry sheets by first cutting the roll in half, straightening each roll and dividing each rectangular sheet of pastry in to three squares, so you get 6 squares in total. You are going to use only 4 of those sheets for this recipe.
6. Spoon the masala mix to the centre of the pastry square and place one half of a hard-boiled egg on top.
7. Fold one corner of the pastry square to the centre on top of the egg; repeat this on all four of the corners.
8. Brush oil on top of each parcel. Repeat till you have prepared all four pastry sheets. Your egg puffs are ready to go in the oven.
9. Place your egg puffs on a baking sheet in the centre of the oven and bake for 25 - 30 minutes. Don't forget to check in between, since ovens vary and you don't want to burn your yummy puffs.
10. Your puffs are ready to eat. Serve with a hot cup of milky tea and a napkin to catch crumbs.

title: Paneer Makhani Pizza Recipe
method: 1. You first need to prepare the makhani gravy. For that, heat oil/ghee in a pan, add the cumin seeds, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon stick and sauté till cumin seeds sizzle, careful not to burn the whole spices, just roast them.
2. Now, add the garlic chunks and sauté for a few seconds. Once done, add in the onions, and cook for 5 minutes or till translucent.
3. Add the turmeric powder and red chili powder and mix everything well.
4. Now is the time to add the tomato puree. Cook on low for 10 minutes, till the oil separates.

5. Add the cream, sugar (optional) and ginger powder. Bring to a simmer. Cook for another 5-10 minutes. Add garam masala and kasoori methi. Remove from flame. Let it cool for a few minutes and then puree to it.

1. Take a large bowl, add the yogurt, lemon juice, ginger garlic paste, oil, red chili powder, kasoori methi, coriander powder, garam masala, cumin powder, turmeric powder and mix it well. Mix until a smooth paste.
2. Add the paneer cubes and marinate the paneer with the mixture. Keep for 15 minutes. Broil in the oven for 8-10 minutes.
1. Preheat oven to the maximum temperature your oven allows. Transfer the pizza base to a square piece of parchment paper.
2. Butter or oil the top a bit, and then spread the makhani sauce.
3. Add the broiled paneer, onion rings and bell peppers. Top with grated cheese (as much as you want). Add a dollop of butter/olive oil on top of it.
4. Wait and enjoy!

title: Potato Rings Recipe
method: 1. In a pan add some butter, garlic, chilli flakes and oregano. Then once it is cooked add some water.
2. Let it boil and add rava.
3. Once the rava soaks the water, allow it to cool down.
4. Next, add two mashed potatoes to it and form a dough.
5. Flatten out this dough and cut out small rings from it using a cutter. Or, you can also cut long strips from it and then make a circle from it.
6. Sprinkle some cornflour and deep fry till crispy.

title: Unicorn Easter Eggs Recipe

ingredient.description: gram Chocolate Coated Butter Scotch Pearls

method: 1. You would require a large egg mould for this.
2. Melt the dark chocolate compound in glass bowl over double boiler. Make sure it does not over heat.
3. Pour the melted dark chocolate in the plastic mould and coat it well. Turn over the mould and empty out the excess chocolate. Leave to set and dry.

4. Once the shells are ready, pour the hazelnut ganache around 30 grams and cover with dark chocolate. Once the dark chocolate is set, fill it with rainbow pearls, chocolate coated butter scotch pearls, chocolate balls and gems.
5. Stick both the shells together.
1. Mix all the ingredients together until fluffy.
1. Take fresh cream in saucepan, bring it to boil and pour on milk chocolate. Mix well then add chocolate hazelnut spread, monin syrup and set it aside.
2. Use unicorn colours in the butter cream and garnish the easter eggs.
3. Green, yellow, purple, red, blue, torquoise colours, you can use for Easter garnish.
1. Take a bit of fondant roll it and dust with golden spray.

title: Green Tikka Tenders Recipe

ingredient.description: cup Chopped coriander and mint leaves

method: 1. Add coriander and mint leaves, lime juice along with ginger garlic and all the dried spices into a blender. Add some water and prepare a fine paste.
2. In a bowl place all the chicken strips and marinate with the paste until evenly coated. Let this sit for 30 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, in different bowls, prepare an egg wash by beating together an egg and milk.
4. Make a flour mix by mixing together flour with some salt and pepper.
5. In another bowl, add breadcrumbs, or crushed popcorn kernels or crushed plain potato chips for the final coating.
6. Once marinated, dip ever single chicken strip in the flour mix, the egg wash and finally the breadcrumbs respectively.
7. Heat oil in a pan and fry the chicken tenders until golden brown.
8. Serve hot with a dip of your choice.

title: Dahi Phulki Recipe
method: 1. First of all, you need to prepare gram flour batter. Add water in gram flour (besan) and keep it aside for 10-15 mins
2. Then take a small portion out of it and dip in hot oil, fried until crispy.
3. Then take a large bowl, fill it with water and drop all the fried pakoras in it and wait until they float.
4. Now, prepare the curd base. Take curd in a large container and beat it nicely. Add salt (remember we have already added salt in phulki so adjust accordingly).
5. Add cumin powder and mix well with curd.
6. Once done, take a wide serving bowl. Take out the phulkis from water and put them in the serving bowl.
7. Garnish the besan ki dahi phulki with red chilli powder, cumin powder, black salt, imli chutney and mint chutney.

title: Sindhi Mutton Fry Recipe
method: 1. Start with washing the mutton pieces properly.
2. Then, apply the papaya paste to the mutton and leave it for half an hour.
3. Grind whole ingredients like cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, star anise in the garam masala into a fine powder. Or you can use store-bought garam masala as well.
4. Heat toil in large vessel, add in the onions and then add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté till the raw aroma goes off.
5. Add the mutton and fry till the colour changes. Mix the rest of the ingredients in a bowl and add to the mutton and fry till it becomes dry and the oil separates.
6. Lastly, add 2 cups of warm water and cover and cook till the mutton is done.

title: Almond And Amaranth Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Roast almond in preheated oven at 180 degree celsius for 4 minutes and cut them roughly once cooled.

2. In a bowl, combine amaranth flour, almond flour, roughly chopped almonds, chopped ginger, chopped onion, chopped green chili, mashed potatoes, salt, red chili powder, garam masala powder and chopped coriander leaves. mix thoroughly.
3. Portion the mix in 25 gm size and keep aside in plate.
4. Heat oil in pan on medium flame, pan fry kebabs to golden and crisp.
5. · Serve hot kebabs with chutney.

title: Sabudana Tikki Recipe
method: 1. To make this scrumptious Navratri special recipe, soak sago (sabudana) in water for around 2 to 3 hours. When the sago has turned a little fluffy, drain the excess water and transfer the sago to a bowl.

2. Now to prepare the tikki mixture, take a big bowl and add the boiled potatoes to it. Mash them completely using your hands. Now add crushed roasted peanuts, chopped green chillies, coriander leaves, red chilli powder and sendha namak along with the drained sago.
3. Make small tikkis of this potato and sago mixture. The tikkis should not be soggy. Now take a pan and add ghee to it. Heat it over moderate flame.
4. Once the ghee is sufficiently hot, carefully place the sago-potato tikkis in it and fry till they turn crispy and brown in colour.
5. Serve hot with Imli chutney and mint.

title: Chicken Doughnuts Recipe
method: 1. Take chicken, garlic, bread crumbs, boiled potato, finely chopped onion, coriander leaves, grated carrot, chilli flakes, chilli powder, salt, cumin seed powder, black pepper powder into a blender jar. Blend these ingredients into a fine paste.
2. Grease oil on a plate and shape the chicken donuts paste into regular-sized flat balls.
3. Keep them in the freezer for 2-3 hrs. Later, cut a hole into the centre of those balls.
4. Now dip these doughnuts in all-purpose flour, egg and bread crumbs. And keep them in the freezer again for 1-2 hours.
5. Afterwards, heat oil in a pan and deep fry the chicken donuts. Once they are crispy and golden in colour, remove them and serve.
6. Your crispy chicken donuts/chicken rings are ready to serve.

title: Papad Pizza Recipe
method: 1. Firstly take a slice of papad, spread pizza sauce on it. If you do not have pizza sauce, mix mayonnaise and ketchup together.
2. Add in the veggies and sprinkle grated cheese top of it.
3. Sprinkle seasonings as per your taste.
4. Bake for 3-4 minutes.
5. Repeat the same process with other papad slice.
6. Serve and enjoy!

title: Salt And Pepper Chicken Recipe

ingredient.description: gms Boneless chicken leg, cut into 1½ inch thin strips
and a half tsp Sesame Oil
2-3 Red bird eye chillies, finely chopped
cup Finely chopped mixed capsicum (red, green and yellow)
and a half tsp Sesame Oil
Chopped fresh spring onion greens for garnishing

method: 1. Put chicken strips in a bowl. Add salt and sesame oil.
2. Break egg yolk in a bowl. Add egg yolk and 1-2 teaspoons egg white to chicken mixture and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes.
3. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
4. Add cornstarch and potato starch to marinated chicken strips and mix till well coated.
5. Put the chicken strips in hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
6. Put black peppercorn and sichuan peppercorns in a mortar and crush using a pestle into coarse powder.
7. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick wok. Add garlic and red bird eye chillies sauté for 1 minute.
8. Add onion and mixed capsicums and sauté for 1 minute. Add sugar, salt and sesame oil and mix well.
9. Drain the fried chicken strips into the sautéed onion mixture and mix. Add crushed peppercorn powder to taste and toss well.
10. Serve hot garnished with spring onion greens.

title: Cheddar Cheese Sole Fish Tikka Recipe
method: 1. In a mixing bowl , add hung curd, oil, lemon juice, ginger garlic paste and Indian spices.
2. Add fish in the marinade and mix well.
3. Cook the marinated fish in the tandoor.
4. Pour saffron cheddar sauce and mix well.
5. Serve with mint chutney and lachha onion.

title: Protein Balls Recipe
method: 1. Place the almonds in a food processor and pulse until they are finely chopped.

2. Add the apricot, dates, honey and orange zest and pulse until a dough consistency is achieved. Roll one heaping teaspoon of dough into little ball then roll the ball through desiccated coconut. Set aside. Repeat until all the dough is used up.
3. The energy balls can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

title: Chicken And Baby Spinach Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Mix all above ingredients well and leave it in a bowl for 5 minute to integrate.
2. Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan and add chopped ginger, green chilli and brown for 2 minutes till finish crackling.
3. Add boneless chicken thigh and cook over high heat for 5 minutes and stir constantly, do not allow to stick at the bottom.
4. Add all crushed spices and powder spices and cook till the chicken is soft (cooked).
5. Add chopped coriander, mint, coriander, spinach and mix well and remove the pan from fire and cool it.

6. When cold, Grind cooked mixture in Robot coup. Add bread crumb and taste the seasoning. (adjust according to taste). Make Patties according to the size as in the picture and leave in the fridge to firm up.
7. Heat very little oil in a none stick pan and grill the Patties (tikki) cook to golden brown.
8. Serve on appropriate plat with garnish of seasoned dollop of piped cream cheese on top and Mint chutney at the bottom.
9. Garnish with red cress.

title: Aloo Corn Cutlets Recipe
method: 1. In a small blender take boiled corn or frozen corn blend to coarse paste without adding any water. Keep 2tbsp corn kernels aside.
2. Transfer the paste to a large mixing bowl and add boiled and mashed potato (Leached), additionally add onion, capsicum, chilli and ginger paste, spices and salt.

3. Add ¼ cup bread crumbs, 1 tbsp roasted besan,1 tbsp corn flour, 2 tbsp of boiled corn removed separately and kept and crushed black pepper, also add lemon juice and combine everything well to form a dough.
4. Add in more bread crumbs if there is too much moisture.
5. Make bullet shaped kebabs greasing hands with oil.
6. Deep fry them into hot oil and fry till the kebabs turn golden brown on medium flame and serve hot.

title: Rava Chana Idli Recipe
method: 1. In a kadai, heat oil and temper with mustard seeds, chana dal, curry leaves, cashewnut and ginger. Add suji and roast for a few minutes.
2. Add salt and mix well.
3. Once the rava cools down, add curd and mix well and set it aside for 30 minutes.
4. After 30 minutes, the mixture will soak up all the curd, add water to get idli batter consistency. Add baking soda and mix well.
5. Take an idli stand and place little grated carrot on the greased mould. Pour the batter and steam for 10-15 minutes.
6. Once done, remove the rava idlis and serve hot with ghee and roasted Bengal gram chutney.

title: Chicken Pizza Crust Recipe
method: 1. First of all, take grated chicken in a bowl, add an egg, parmesan and mozzarella cheese to it.
2. After this, add oregano, chilli flakes, black pepper and salt and mix everything well.
3. Now spread this mixture on a parchment in a baking tray and bake it for 15 minutes.
4. After this spread pizza sauce on it, add chicken salami or veggies with cheese and then bake it in the oven for some time.
5. Enjoy your delicious pizza with chili flakes, oregano and ketchup.

title: Mix Vegetable Idli Recipe

ingredient.description: tbsp Garlic and ginger garlic paste.

method: 1. Take a bowl, add gram flour and semolina.
2. Then add salt, capsicum pcs, tomato, green chilli, ginger-garlic paste, chopped green garlic, chopped carrot, green peas, chopped coriander, and curd.
3. Let it rest for about 15-20 mins.
4. Once done, add paneer and mix again.
5. Now, grease the idli moulds with oil. Fill a portion of the batter.
6. Steam for about 10-12 mins. Check if the idlis are cooked or not by using a toothpick.
7. Serve and enjoy!

title: Suji Medu Vada Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add semolina, ginger, green chilli, onion, cumin, green coriander, curry leaves and salt as per taste and mix everything well.
2. Now add curd and a little water to it and make a thick batter.
3. Add fruit salt or sweet soda to it before making vada.
4. Heat oil in a pan and grease your hand with oil and make the shape of a vada and fry it till it becomes crispy golden.
5. Enjoy it with chutney or sambar.

title: Chicken Hakka Noodles Recipe
method: 1. Boil the chicken till it is tender.
2. Now heat oil in pan and cook pan fry the chicken pieces to give it a slightly crisp texture.
3. Once that is done, throw in veggies like onion, capsicum, carrots and more. Let it cook for a while.
4. Now add soy sauce, vinegar, pepper, salt and a bit of chilli flakes. Stir it well.
5. Next, throw in the boiled noodles and combine everything well.
6. Check the taste and adjust the spices as per your taste.
7. Once cooked, take it out in a bowl and garnish with spring onions before serving!

title: Keema Roll Recipe
method: 1. First of all, heat oil in a pan, add finely chopped onion and ginger garlic paste and fry it.
2. Add the minced keema and fry it with onions for some time. After a while add finely chopped tomatoes and cook it till it gets cooked well.
3. After this, add salt, red chili, turmeric, chicken masala, cumin powder, coriander powder and mix all the things and fry the minced meat.
4. After sometime the minced keema will start leaving oil. Now add thinly sliced capsicum, onion and carrot and cook for two more minutes. Then take it off and keep it aside.
1. Now in a bowl add all purpose flour, curd, salt and little oil and knead soft dough with water after mixing all the things.
2. Let the dough rest for 10 minutes. After a while, make balls from the dough and make parathas. do it.
3. Then spread mayonnaise on the paratha, add tomato ketchup, add keema stuffing. Add green chutney and mayonnaise on it.
4. Roll it with foil and serve with your favourite dip or chutney.

title: Afghani Momos Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in pan, deep fry or pan fry the momos until crispy.
2. Now the next step is to take a bowl, add in curd or cream along with all the spices.
3. Then, add fried momos along with a spoon of melted butter and momos chutney. Mix everything well.
4. Garnish with coriander leaves and your Afghani momos are ready!

title: Chicken Tikka Burger Recipe

ingredient.description: Boneless chicken breasts cut into ½ inch cubes

method: 1. Place chicken cubes in a bowl, add salt, ½ tsp Kashmiri red chilli powder and juice of ½ lemon and mix well.
2. Set aside in a refrigerator to marinate for 15 minutes.
3. Mix together hung yogurt, garlic paste, ginger paste, salt, ½ teaspoon Kashmiri red chilli powder, garam masala powder and mustard oil in a bowl.
4. Add chicken and mix well. Set aside in the refrigerator to marinate for 3-4 hours. Halve the burger buns horizontally. Cut onion into thick roundels.
5. Put some butter on a heated griller and place the onion roundels on it and grill till lightly browned.
6. Mix together mayonnaise and green chutney in a small bowl. Remove onion from the griller and place in a bowl.
7. Arrange chicken pieces on the griller, drizzle a little oil and cook till the chicken is cooked and golden.
8. Apply mayonnaise-green chutney over all the burger halves.
9. Tear a few lettuce leaves and place over the bottom halves.
10. Arrange the chicken tikkas over the lettuce and place the onion roundels over them.
11. Cover with the top halves of the burgers and press lightly. Serve immediately.

title: Chicken and Mushroom Pasta Recipe
method: 1. Cut the chicken breast into small pieces, coat it with garlic powder, thyme and a little bit of salt and pepper.
2. Then heat oil in a saucepan, add the chicken chunks and stir fry for some time. Remove and keep aside.
3. Now, in the same pan, add butter, mushrooms and fry until golden. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. Pour in 60ml of white wine and let it reduce until nearly gone. Once done, add chicken stock along with heavy cream and stir for about 5-6 mins.
5. Meanwhile, boil the pasta. Retain a cup of starchy pasta water before draining.
6. Add in parsley and parmesan in the saucepan. Season according to the taste, then pour in your pasta.
7. Stir to coat, then add your chicken pieces. Give it a good stir, using your starchy pasta water to thin out as necessary.
8. Serve with extra parmesan and enjoy!

title: Achari Aloo Tikka Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half tsp Mixed pickle paste
and a half tsp Ginger-garlic paste
and a half tsp Roasted gram flour
tsp Dried fenugreek leaves (kasoori methi) powdered

method: 1. Take hung yogurt in a bowl, add ginger-garlic paste, roasted gram flour, salt, chaat masala powder, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, dried fenugreek powder, mixed pickle paste and mustard oil, and whisk well.
2. Add the potatoes to this paste and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.
3. Preheat at 180˚C and grease a baking tray with butter.
4. Keep each potato on the baking tray, taking care they do not touch each other. Keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.
5. Brush with butter and transfer to a serving plate, garnish with coriander sprigs and serve hot with green chutney.

title: Chicken Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Add the ingredients for the first marinade in a bowl and mix well.
2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 3-4 hours or overnight.
3. Add the ingredients for the second marinade in the bowl and mix well.
4. Keep the marinated chicken aside for 30 minutes.
5. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
6. Thread the marinated chicken in the skewers along with onion and capsicum.
7. Line the skewers on a foil lined baking tray.
8. Grill for 10-12 minutes and then rotate the skewers.
9. Grill for another 10-12 minutes.
10. Increase the oven temperature to 420 Degrees F and broil the skewers for 3-4 minutes until they are slightly charred.

title: Jam Heart Cookies Recipe
method: 1. Cream butter and sugar till fluffy.
2. Add egg white gradually and mix well.
3. Lastly add flour and almond powder and mix smooth dough.
4. Keep in the freezer for two hours
5. Take out the dough from freezer and roll 4 mm thick sheet. Cut into heart shape with cookies cutters.
6. Cut out center with the smaller cookies from half of them.
7. Bake at 175 degree celsius for 14 minutes till golden color.
8. Arrange the cookies with center hollow on top.
9. Boil the jam till it thick to soft balls. Fill cookies with jam and leave till the jam set.

title: Tandoori Aloo Bharta Recipe
method: 1. First of all, take hung curd in a bowl, add ginger, garlic paste, green chili paste, red chili, black pepper, coriander powder, gram flour and tandoori masala and mix it.
2. Add boiled potatoes to it, mix and put in a baking tray and bake for 30 to 40 minutes.
3. Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin, cardamom and black pepper seeds to it. Add onions and fry for 2 minutes.
4. Add ginger garlic paste and fry it for some time. Add tomatoes and fry, now add red chili, finely chopped green chilies, coriander powder, salt as per taste and tandoori masala and mix
5. Add a tablespoon of curd and mix it well. Add kasoori methi. Now add the baked potatoes and mix.
6. Garnish with green coriander and serve.

title: Instant Oats Dosa Recipe
method: 1. First, roast the oats lightly. Now let it cool down and add some fenugreek seeds to it and make powder.
2. Take out this powder in a bowl, add one spoon of semolina and rice flour to it.
3. If you do not have rice flour, then you can also add a spoonful of wheat flour to it. One spoon curd, salt as per taste, black pepper, asafoetida, curry leaves, grated ginger. Mix all the things.
4. Make a good consistency batter by adding water as per the requirement. Let it rest for 15 to 20 minutes, now add finely chopped green chilies, curry leaves and finely chopped onions.
5. Flip the other side and bake lightly and serve with chutney or sambar.

title: Chilli Idli Recipe
method: 1. You can use leftover idli or you can also use fresh idli to make chilli idli.
2. Take idlis and cut them into desired shape. Make a thin batter by mixing corn starch, all purpose flour, salt, pepper and ginger garlic paste in a bowl.
3. Heat oil in a pan, coat the idlis well in the batter and fry them in oil till they turn crispy golden.
4. After this, heat oil in another pan, add finely chopped garlic, green chili and onion and fry it lightly.
5. Add capsicum, black pepper and a little salt to it. Now add red chili sauce, ketchup, vinegar and soy sauce to it.
6. Cook all these things for few seconds. Add corn starch liquid to it and mix. After this add fried idli and mix it well. Serve garnished with green onions.

title: Chicken Mayo Roll Recipe
method: 1. First of all, take boneless chicken in a bowl, add ginger garlic paste, curd, red chilli, coriander, turmeric, salt and chaat masala and marinate for some time.
2. After this, heat oil in a pan, put the chicken pieces in it and wait till it gets cooked completely.
3. Meanwhile, knead the dough by mixing maida and wheat flour in a bowl and let it rest for some time.
4. Now look back at the chicken, if it is completely cooked, then turn off the flame. Take the prepared dough and make balls out of it and make parathas in circular shape.
5. Take mayonnaise in a bowl, add chilli flakes and oregano to it. Spread it on the paratha, also add lettuce and now put chicken pieces on it.
6. Place sliced onions on it, add some more mayonnaise along with it and prepare rolls by wrapping them well.
7. Serve and enjoy!

title: Tandoori Bharwan Capsicum Recipe
method: 1. Cut and deseed capsicum. Apply little oil and sprinkle some salt. Keep it aside.
2. In a pan heat some oil and add ginger garlic paste, chopped onions. Chopped vegetables like carrots and cauliflower, but this is optional.
3. Add mashed potatoes and paneer and all the other dried spices and peanuts.
4. Mix well until everything is well incorporated. Take off the heat and some chopped coriander leaves too.
5. Dab the capsicum dry and fill with the stuffing.
6. In a non-stick pan. Drizzle little oil and roast both sides of the capsicum not more than 2-3 minutes.
7. Once the exterior starts getting slightly charred, remove from heat and serve hot.

title: Tandoori Nazakat Aloo Recipe

ingredient.description: a few sprigs fresh coriander leaves
a few sprigs fresh mint leaves

method: 1. Peel potatoes and scoop out from the centre to make a barrel. Reserve the scooped-out portions.

2. Heat oil in a kadai and deep fry the potatoes till light golden. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside. Similarly deep fry the scooped-out portions of the potatoes till golden, drain on absorbent paper and set aside.
3. Preheat the oven to 200° C.
4. Take cottage cheese in a bowl, add fried scooped out potato portions, cashewnuts and raisins. Chop mint leaves and coriander leaves and add to the bowl.
5. Add salt, 1 teaspoon red chilli powder, 1 teaspoon green chilli paste, ginger, 1 teaspoon chaat masala and 1 teaspoon garam masala powder and mash well while mixing.

6. Take hung yogurt in another bowl , add garlic paste, ginger paste, roasted chana dal powder, salt, turmeric powder, remaining red chilli powder, cumin powder, remaining chaat masala, dried fenugreek leaf powder, remaining garam masala powder, remaining green chilli paste and 1 tbsp hot oil and mix well. Stuff potatoes with this cottage cheese mixture.
7. Grease a non-stick baking tray. Apply yogurt marinade generously over the stuffed potatoes and place in the baking tray. Keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.
8. Halve the potatoes vertically, arrange them in a serving plate and serve hot garnished with mint sprig.

title: Goan Chicken Rava Fry Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl and add yoghurt.
2. To this, add red chilli powder, pepper, salt, cardamom powder, ginger garlic paste, lemon and cloves. Mix it well.
3. Then take the chicken pieces and marinate them with the prepared paste for half an hour.
4. Then take semolina on a plate, coat the chicken pieces, and pan-fry it.
5. Once the chicken turns brown and crisp, garnish it with coriander leaves. Then it is ready to be served!

title: Garlic Butter Chicken Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add boneless chicken chunks, salt, half of the pepper, egg, and mix well. Now add the maida and let it coat well. Mix and keep it aside for at least 15 minutes.
2. Fry the chicken chunks until golden brown on all sides.
3. In another pan add butter and minced garlic, mix until the raw smell is gone. Now add onions, red chili flakes, oregano, salt, and pepper and mix well.
4. Make cornflour slurry with 1 tsp. cornflour and one bowl of water. Add the slurry to the pan and mix well.
5. Once the slurry is well cooked, add one bowl of water and make it liquidy enough to coat all the chicken pieces.
6. Add the fried chicken and mix until all pieces are coated with the gravy. Garnish with spring onions in the end and serve hot.

title: Chicken Boti Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Dry roast the gram flour in a saucepan.
2. Marinate the chicken in curd, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, nutmeg, cumin powder, coriander powder, besan, mustard oil, Kashmiri red chilli, black salt and salt.
3. Make sure you marinate it for at least an hour.
4. Soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes.
5. Thread the chicken cubes in the soaked skewers and set aside.
6. Heat a non-stick pan and add oil. Once the oil is hot, place the chicken skewers.
7. Let it cook till it evenly brown. Repeat the method by flipping the skewers. The chicken boti kebab is ready!
8. Serve the boti kebab with onion rings and pudina chutney and you’ll have a party on a plate.

title: Whole Wheat Chicken Momo Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add the meat, onions, ginger, coriander leaves, and butter and mix well.
2. Use your hands to properly rub all the ingredients together, add salt according to taste and let it rest for 10-15 minutes.
3. In the meanwhile, make a dough by mixing atta, a pinch of salt, oil, and water. Mix lightly hard dough and keep aside.
4. Make tiny balls out of the dough and roll out the tiny balls of dough in the size of a small poori.
5. Place a spoonful of filling in the middle and use a mold to shape the dumpling.
6. Or you can gather all the sides together and pinch it.
7. Grease the steaming plates with oil and let this steam for 20-30 minutes.
8. Check if the outer dough is cooked and serve hot.

title: Chicken Hara Bhara Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Boil spinach leaves and peas. Crush the peas. Peel the potatoes and crush.
2. Saute onion and ginger-garlic paste.
3. Add minced chicken, salt and all the spice powders.
4. When cooked, add in blanched spinach, peas and potatoes.
5. Make small roundels out of the mixture and flatten them slightly.
6. Coat in rice flour and fry.

title: Paneer Bhurji Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. In a kadhai, heat oil and saute garlic and cumin seeds. Remove it from heat.
2. Add paneer, red chilli powder, masala powder, turmeric, salt, coriander leaves, amchur powder and mix it well.
3. Spread butter on the bread, place onion rings, tomatoes and paneer bhurji. Close the sandwich, and grill it.
4. Serve and enjoy!

title: Allam Kodi Wings Roast Recipe
method: 1. Wash and clean the chicken thoroughly and drain all the water.

2. In a mixing bowl, add chicken wings, two tablespoons of chilli powder, 3 chillies finely chopped, 1/2 tablespoon of turmeric powder, 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste, 1 tablespoon garam masala, and 1 tablespoon of oil, and add salt to taste. Let it sit for 10 minutes.
3. Place the marinated chicken wings on the skewers and place them in the coal-fired tandoor oven to cook for 10 minutes

4. Add 10 ml oil to the frying pan and add chopped onion (80 gm), chopped garlic (30 gm), chopped ginger (50gm), curry leaf, ginger paste & add the chicken wings. Sauté the chicken wings until they form a roast.
5. Add chopped coriander leaves and cut off the flame.
6. Transfer the smoky Allam Kodi wings roast to the serving plate, garnish with finely chopped onion salad.

title: Tandoori Chaap Recipe
method: 1. Remove the stick from the chaap and cut it into small pieces.
2. Add all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
3. Add the soya chaap pieces and mix well again.
4. Cover the pan and keep aside for 30 minutes.
5. Thread the chaap in skewers.
6. Cook the chaap over direct flame until nicely browned.
7. Transfer the cooked chaap in a mixing bowl.
8. Add the ingredients mentioned in serving and toss well.
9. Serve immediately.

title: Bharwan Capsicum Omelette Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl and break an egg in it.
2. Then add chopped onions and tomatoes with salt, pepper and red chilli. Whisk it properly.
3. Take one capsicum, remove the top of it. Deseed and clean it from the inside.
4. Add the egg mixture in capsicum, top it with some cheese, and bake until cooked.
5. Once it is done, serve and enjoy with your family!

title: Bajra Raab Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add some warm water and let the jaggery soak for 5-10 mins.
2. Meanwhile in a pan, add ghee and cook the Bajra flour until the color has changed.
3. In a pan add the jaggery water mix and boil in low flame.
4. In the pan with bajra, add the jaggery water mix and some milk too. Mix well to make sure no clumps are left.
5. After cooking this for 5 mins, add ginger powder and elaichi powder. Drizzle shaved nuts for garnishing but that is optional.
6. Serve hot for breakfast.

title: Homemade Veg Grilled Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Cut cucumber, onion and capsicum into this slices.
2. Mix grated carrot and paneer. Add in mayonnaise.
3. Smear 4 bread slices with some tomato sauce. Sprinkle salt and pepper.
4. Place the veggies on all of them.
5. Top it with grated veggie mix.
6. Place cheese slice. Cover with another slice and grill with butter.

title: Fish Kathi Roll Recipe

ingredient.description: cup Thinly sliced red or yellow peppers

method: 1. Marinate the fish. Take a bowl, add fish pieces along with ginger garlic paste and salt. Keep aside.
2. Meanwhile, heat oil in a pan, saute garlic, ginger and onions until light brown. Add tomatoes and fry for a few minutes. Add marinated fish and stir fry again. Add all the spices and mix again.
1. Heat tawa, grease it with oil. Place one chapatti or paratha on the gridle and brush with beaten egg. Cook from both the sides.
2. Top with a spoon or two of your fish filling. Spoon a little bit of green chutney/sauce of choice in the centre.
3. Sprinkle sliced carrots, onions, cabbage on the top. Grate paneer or cheese and roll the roti tightly over the stuffing.
4. Place on the tava cheese side down. Melted cheese will help it to stick together. Heat both sides on medium heat, turning over gently with a flat spatula.
5. Serve with any fresh salad and chutney of choice.

title: Chilli Garlic Prawns Recipe

ingredient.description: tbsp cornflour and 1 tbsp water (Cornflour slurry)

method: 1. Take cornflour in a bowl and add all purpose flour, garlic paste, ginger paste, dark soy sauce, black pepper powder to it.
2. Now crack an egg to the mix, and whisk it without leaving any lumps.
3. Add deveined prawns to the bowl, and mix it nicely.
4. Now add these prawns to the hot oil, in a pan, and let it fry on each side.
5. Once fried, take it out on a plate and keep it aside.
6. Take cornflour in a small bowl; add water to it and mix it.
7. Now, take oil in a pan and add minced garlic, minced ginger to it.
8. Mix it till the raw smell goes away.
9. Add sliced spring onions to the pan, along with slit green chillies.
10. Now, turn the flame to medium and add chopped capsicum, black pepper powder, dark soy sauce, chilli sauce to it and mix it.
11. Add water to the pan and mix it, and then, add the slurry, fried prawns to the pan.
12. Mix it together and coat the prawns with the sauce.
13. Add salt, vinegar to the pan; mix it again and serve it.

title: Tandoori Chicken Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add four-five chicken pieces. Marinate it with curd, red chilli powder pepper, chaat masala, garam masala, salt and ginger garlic paste.
2. Once done, let it rest for a while. Then bake it in an oven or pan. Once it is charred, take it out.
3. Then take two slices of bread, add a layer of barbecue sauce.
4. Then add a piece of cheese, tandoori chicken, onions, tomatoes, and capsicum.
5. Finally, add hot sauce, mustard sauce or any other sauce of your choice.
6. Close it from the top, cut and serve to enjoy!

title: Chilli Chaap Recipe
method: 1. First, take raw soya chaap and boil it. Cut it into pieces and deep fry.
2. Next, add oil, ginger-garlic paste, and dry red chilli to a pan. Mix it well.
3. Then add chopped onion and capsicum. Stir it, and add soy sauce, red chilli sauce, schezwan sauce, vinegar and some water. Let it come to a boil.
4. Now throw in the chaap pieces and combine.
5. Now, in a small bowl, add cornflour and water to make a slurry.
6. Throw this in a pan and let it boil. Once done, take it out and serve!

title: Achaari Fish Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Put lemon juice, ginger and garlic paste in a bowl and keep aside for 10 minutes.
2. Now take curd in another bowl, add red chilli powder, coriander powder, salt, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, pickle masala and oil and mix.
3. Add fish fillets to this mixture and let it marinate for 20 minutes.
4. After this, put the pieces of fish in the skewer and roast it in the tandoor.
5. You can also roast them in a nonstick pan or bake them in a preheated 180 degree oven for 15 minutes.
6. Serve with mint chutney and onion rings.

title: Mutton Spring Roll Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add Maida, salt, sugar, half of the oil and water to knead soft dough. Pat the dough with more oil and let it rest for some time.
2. In a pan add oil, chopped ginger and garlic, chopped onions, minced meat and soy sauce and ketchup. Add salt and black pepper and mix until cooked.
3. Roll very thin roti out of the dough, put the filling in the middle and roll tightly. Use a Maida and water slurry to close the roll.
4. Deep fry in hot oil until golden and crispy. Serve with a dip of your choice.

title: Chicken Garlic Bread Recipe

ingredient.description: A large pinch of crushed black peppercorns
tsp dried red chilli flakes + for sprinkling

method: 1. Preheat the oven at 180˚C.
2. Take butter in a bowl, add garlic, parsley, crushed black peppercorns, dried red chilli flakes, salt and chicken and mix well.
3. Arrange bread slices on a baking tray and place a portion of chicken mixture on each slice.
4. Keep the baking tray in the oven and bake for 6-8 minutes. Bring the tray out of the oven and arrange the bread slices on a serving plate.
5. Sprinkle dried red chilli flakes and garnish with fresh parsley sprigs. Serve hot.

title: Schezwan Dosa Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half Cup Dosa Batter

method: 1. To prepare the filling for dosa, heat oil in a wok then add ginger and garlic when oil becomes hot. Saute for just few seconds.
2. Now, add onions, green chillies and saute on high heat for 30 secs. Add capsicum, carrots, cabbage and beans. Fry them on high heat for 2-3 mins.
3. Veggies should remain crunchy. Add boiled noodles along with 2 teaspoon Schezwan sauce, tomato sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, pepper and salt.
4. Toss them well to coat everything with sauces nicely. Switch off the flame and mix in spring onion greens. Let the stuffing cool down little bit.
5. Now, heat a non stick griddle pan. Brush lightly with oil. Wipe it with a tissue. Pour one ladleful of dosa batter and spread it to make big dosa.
6. Smear some oil on sides and top of the dosa. Now, spread the Schezwan sauce nicely on the top of dosa.
7. Let the dosa become nicely crisp from bottom and cooked from top as well. No need to flip and cook the other side.
8. Place some stuffing on one side of dosa and carefully lift the other side and fold into half moon. Take it out on to a plate.
9. Similarly make other dosas.
10. Serve hot.

title: Atta Dosa Recipe
method: 1. To make this dish, first in a bowl mix wheat flour, rice flour, salt, slit green chillies, curry leaves, jeera and mix.
2. Then add water to it and make a smooth batter.
3. Once the batter is ready, pour a ladle full of it on a greased hot pan.
4. Let it cook from one side, then add some oil to another side.
5. Flip the dosa and cook till a crisp.
6. Lastly, take it out and enjoy!

title: Andhra Style Chicken Fry Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, you need to marinate the chicken with salt, red chili powder, ginger and garlic paste, turmeric and curd and keep aside for an hour.
2. Now, slice onions. Also, chop the coriander leaves and squeeze lemon juice in a separate bowl. Then crush the cashews into powdered form and keep aside.
3. Once the chicken is marinated, heat ghee in a large wok, cook onions on low flame till the onion turns translucent.
4. Now, add marinated chicken in the wok and cook until the chicken turns tender and juicy.
5. Meanwhile, heat oil in an other pan, heat oil and sautee green chillies and curry leaves.
6. Now, add this tadka to the chicken wok along with powdered cashews, black pepper, salt, red chilli and salt to taste.
7. Now fry the chicken for sometime. Keep stirring for about 5 minutes. At last, add chopped coriander leaves and lemon juice.
8. Serve hot with roti or naan and rice.

title: Dal Farra Recipe

ingredient.description: Cup Rice Flour/ Whole wheat flour

method: 1. In a bowl wash and soak chana, urad and matar dal for 2-3 hours.
2. Once done, put the dal mix in grinder. Add garlic and chilies too. Make a fine paste.
3. Mix salt, red chilli powder, haldi, garam masala and cumin seeds to the dal mix and let it sit.
4. Knead a soft dough with rice flour/whole wheat flour, water and some salt. Make tiny puri.
5. Place the dal mix on one side of the puri and fold with the other side.
6. Prepare a steamer and steam the Farra for around 20 minutes.
7. Once done, take off the heat and keep aside.
8. In another pan heat some oil, crackle mustard seeds, hing, curry leaves, add the steamed farra and sauté for a couple of minutes.
9. Cut in the middle or make rough three slices and enjoy.

title: Sooji Manchurian Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half cup Capsicum (Cut into large pieces)

method: 1. For balls: Take a large container, add sooji, curd, salt, pepper along with some finely chopped veggies. Add water and mix it well. Keep it aside.
2. Make small balls out of the dough and bake, air fry or steam them for about 10 minutes.
3. Once the balls are ready, heat oil in a wok, add ginger garlic , green chillies and chopped cabbage, grated carrot and diced onions and capsicum. Saute the veggies for 2-3 minutes.
4. To this add soya sauce, vinegar, chilli sauce (optional) and tomato ketchup. Now add the water, stir and let it cook for minute or so.
5. Add corn flour mixed with water to thicken the consistency of the gravy. Now, add the manchurian balls to the pan and mix it well with gravy.
6. Garnish with some coriander leaves and enjoy!

title: Oats Dahi Masala Recipe
method: 1. Take oats and boil it till it softens.
2. Till then, finely chop onions, cucumber, carrots, tomatoes and any other vegetable of your choice.
3. When the oats are ready put them in a bowl. Add in the veggies and curd and mix well.
4. Throw in spices like red chilli powder, pepper, and salt. Combine them together.
5. Now in a small pan, heat some oil and add mustard seeds, curry leaves, one dry red chilli, cumin seeds and urad dal.
6. When it starts to splutter, pour this in the oats bowl. Mix and enjoy!

title: Egg Samosa Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl mix together maida, baking powder and salt. Add onion seeds and oil. Knead into a smooth dough. Allow it to rest for 1-2 hours.
2. Heat oil in a pan and then saute the onions and green chillies until onions turn golden-pink. Add the grated potatoes and carrots. Stir-fry for a minute.
3. Add salt, and coriander leaves. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or till the potatoes are soft and mushy.
4. Now break the eggs into the pan and cook until the eggs are done. Remove from fire and allow it to cool.
5. Make small balls of the dough and roll them into thin and small chapatis.
6. Place the egg mixture and shape them into small/medium triangles. Seal the edges with little water.
7. Deep fry the prepared samosas in small batches until golden brown. Remove and drain excess oil.
8. Serve hot with ketchup, onion rings and the chutney of your choice!

title: Pahadi Kebab Recipe
method: 1. In a grinder, add coriander and mint leaves, chillies, ginger-garlic, black peppercorns, lime juice, curd, salt and some water. Make a fin paste out of these ingredients.
2. In another bowl add chicken chunks and the prepared masala and let this marinate for at least one hour.
3. Once the chicken is marinated, place it in a heated pan with little oil and fry until 80%done.
4. Take off the heat and place these chicken chunks into skewers and roast on pen flame, make sure to keep brushing these with ghee to keep the chunks moist and flavourful.
5. In case you don’t own skewers; you can simply roast the chicken pieces in a pan. Take a non-stick pan and place the already cooked chicken pieces on it. Don’t add any oil, just the chicken pieces.
6. Cook on high heat for 2 minutes on each side until charred evenly. Now lower the heat and pour some ghee on top of each piece. Cook for another minute and you are done.

title: Moong Dal Handvo Recipe
method: 1. Take a blender and add soaked moong dal, ginger and garlic. Blend these together.
2. Transfer this in a bowl.
3. Now in the same bowl add semolina, besan, green chillies.
4. Before cooking add fruit salt, mix and steam it for 10 minutes.
5. Till then in a small kadhai, add oil, curry leaves, mustard seeds and heeng.
6. Once the handvo is ready pour this tempering from the top and serve!

title: Butter Chicken Pasta Recipe

ingredient.description: 4-5 Boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite size pieces
A pinch of Orange food color, optional
and a half cup Finely chopped onion

method: 1. Marinate the chicken for 4-6 hours.

2. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When hot, add chicken in a single layer, cook for about 2 minutes, turn over and continue cooking for additional 2 minutes. Remove chicken into a bowl (chicken will not be fully cooked at this point).
3. Reduce heat to medium, add butter to the same skillet and let melt. Add cumin seeds and let sizzle for few seconds.
4. Stir in chopped onion, crushed garlic, ginger and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring often, until onions get golden brown color (4-5 minutes).
5. Add kasuri methi, coriander powder, cayenne and garam masala powder. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until spices are toasted well (don't let it burn).

6. Add tomato sauce, cashew powder and chicken (along with all accumulated juices), stir well, reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 10 minutes (stirring every 3-4 minutes to make sure that it does not burn in the bottom).
7. Add cooked pasta and toss well.

title: Chicken Majestic Recipe
method: 1. Soak chicken in buttermilk for 4 hours. Drain the chicken and marinate it in ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, corn flour and red chilli powder.
2. Deep fry the chicken till it is golden brown. You can also pan fry the chicken if you like. Keep it aside.
3. Now for the masala, place a wok on heat. Saute curry leaves and green chillies in oil. Fry till the curry leaves are crispy and the garlic cooked.
4. Next add mint leaves, red chilli powder and garam masala, mix it well. Pour in the yoghurt, stir till the moisture is evaporated. Add soya sauce and the fried chicken. Mix it well, and serve!

title: Andhra Style Beans Kudumulu Recipe
method: 1. In a pan heat enough water to submerge the beans. Add little salt and let it boil until the beans are 80% done.
2. In a grinder take green chilli, onion, garlic, ginger and make a paste.
3. Add the green chilli paste in the boiling beans. Mix well and then add rice flour. Mix rice flour as much as you can and then take off the heat.
4. Once cooled, add coriander leaves and mash together to make a soft dough.
5. Shape it as idli or small cutlet with hands.
6. If you want you can steam it in an idli maker, make sure to grease the pan and steam as usual.
7. If you are cooking it in a pan, add refined oil and mustard seeds, place one batch of kudumulu and let it sit in the oil for a while. Now add some water and let it steam until done.

title: Honey Chicken Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, take boneless chicken pieces and fry them for 4-5 minutes on medium flame. Once done, keep them aside.
2. Then place a pan on medium flame, add butter and honey onto it. Once the butter is melted, turn off the flame.
3. Now add lemon juice, ginger garlic paste and salt in the same pan and mix everything well.
4. Add the chicken pieces into this honey mixture and cook for about 10 minutes on low-medium flame. Ps: If you want a fiery texture, you can also use schezwan sauce.
5. Your honey chicken recipe is ready to be savoured.

title: Soya Idli Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, soak dal, rice and soyabean separately in bowls.
2. Add methi seeds and chana dal together in the bowl of urad dal. Soak the rice atleast 5-6 hours.
3. Once soaked, grind all the ingredients together into a thick and consistent paste. Add a little bit of water and grind again.
4. Add the salt and stir well to combine. Cover the bowl and ferment the Batter for at least 6 hours or overnight.
5. Once fermented, mix again. Steam in an idli steamer and serve hot with sambar and nariyal ki chutney alongside.

title: Egg Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Take a large container, add hung curd or yogurt along with dry spices (mentioned above), salt, lemon juice, mustard oil and gram flour and mix well.
2. Cut the eggs into two halves and then dip all the eggs in the batter, mix gently and set aside for 10-15 minutes.
3. Preheat the oven to 180- 200 degree C. Grease a baking tray with melted butter or ghee, place the eggs on the baking tray.
4. You may add a piece of burnt coal once the eggs are prepared.
5. Garnish with onion rings and serve with green chutney and lemon wedge alongside.

title: Lauki Dosa Recipe
method: 1. Take a lauki and remove the skin and deseed it.
2. Then add it to a blender with some water to form a smooth paste.
3. Transfer this in a bowl and add rice flour and sooji, green chilli, salt and water.
4. Combine to form dosa batter. Keep the batter aside for 15 minutes.
5. Now heat a pan and drop a ladle full of this batter to cook.
6. Once it is brown and crisp, serve with chutney and enjoy!

title: Aloo Ke Chapli Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, take a large container, add the shredded potatoes. To this, jeera powder, crushed coriander seeds, salt and dried chillies (as per taste). Mix and add amchur powder or chaat masala.
2. After this, add finely chopped green chillies, chopped onion, coriander, mint leaves and bread crumbs.
3. Mix everything together and make flat round shapes (similar to tikkis).
4. Heat oil in a pan and place these kebabs on top of the pan and cook the kebabs until each side turns golden-brown.
5. Serve hot with mint chutney and onion rings on the side.

title: Murmura Poha Recipe
method: 1. First take a murmura and wash it gently.
2. Now in a pan heat some oil, add curry leaves, peanuts, chopped onion, tomato, potato turmeric powder, red chilli powder and mix.
3. Cook it till the veggies turn soft.
4. Now toss in the murmura and add salt. Combine again.

title: Chicken Cheese Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl, add cooked and shredded chicken along with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, mayonnaise and some oregano, mix everything well.
2. Once done, add cheese spread or cream cheese.
3. Now take two slices of bread (any bread according to your preference), fill it with the mixture and add some veggies (optional), grill the sandwich until brown and crispy from both sides.
4. Serve with your favourite dip and enjoy!

title: Masala Bread Recipe
method: 1. In a grinder, add onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, green chilli and some salt. Grind to a smooth paste.
2. In pan heat some oil. Add cumin seeds and the grinded masala.
3. Let this cook for some time and then add haldi, red chili powder and salt according to taste.
4. In another pan toast bread slices and roughly chop into 6-8 pieces.
5. Add the bread chunks to the cooked masala and mix well.
6. Once the bread chunks are well coated, take off the heat and garnish with chaat masala and fresh coriander. Serve hot.

title: Bhungara Batata Recipe
method: 1. In a pan, heat some oil and add cumin seeds and asafoetida, mix this for a while and then add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
2. Add chopped onions and cook until soft, add tomato puree and cook for a while.
3. Add all the dried spices like turmeric, chili powders, coriander, and garam masala, and salt according to taste.
4. Once everything is mixed well and cooked, add boiled baby potatoes and mix for some time.
5. Once the baby potatoes are well coated with the masala, take off the heat and keep them aside.
6. Fry the yellow fryums and serve hot and crispy with the batata.

title: Paneer Shawarma Recipe
method: 1. Take paneer and mash it with a potato masher, then add all the dry seasonings mentioned in the ingredients list.
2. Meanwhile, heat a grill pan, add this mixture and roast it from both the sides till the grill mark appears on both the sides. Remove and set aside for 5-8 minutes.
