3. Then, make chapatis by using wheat flour, cook them properly on tawa.
4. Spread mayonnaise on top of the bread and then add the paneer mixture. Roll it out.
5. Serve along with mint chutney and mayonnaise.

title: Hyderabadi Chicken Fry Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add chicken and all the dry masalas. Add crud, crushed fried onions, and the chopped leaves as well.
2. Mix everything well and let it marinate for an hour.
3. In a kadhai, heat some oil and add the whole spices – Cinnamon, cardamom, cloves and star anise.
4. Add the chicken along with the marinated masala and cook until soft and tender.
5. Garnish with some freshly chopped coriander leaves and curry leaves before serving hot.

title: Urad Dal Vada Recipe
method: 1. First up, grind soaked white urad dal along with water in a grinder. Add a little bit of water.
2. Then transfer this batter into a large mixing bowl and add the chopped onions, green chillies and sooji along with salt and red chilli powder to taste.
3. Mix everything well.
4. Heat oil in a large bottomed pan, add a spoonful of batter one after another.
5. Wait until both the sides of the fritters become brown and crispy.
6. Once done, transfer them on a serving plate and serve with green chutney and masala chai.

title: Paneer Popcorn Recipe
method: 1. In a mixing bowl, add paneer, Kashmiri red chilli powder, dry parsley, oregano, black pepper powder and salt. Mix the paneer gently so that the paneer cubes don’t break.
2. In another bowl, take besan, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder and baking soda.
3. Pour water to the bowl and mix it to make a thick batter. The batter should be smooth and without any lumps.
4. Dip each paneer cube in the batter till it is completely covered. Place the coated paneer in breadcrumbs.
5. Fry the coated paneer till they are golden, the paneer popcorn is ready!

title: Tomato Egg Stir-Fry Recipe

ingredient.description: Salt and Pepper as per taste

method: 1. Take two eggs and slightly scramble them on a pan. Then keep it aside.
2. Now take some oil in a pan and add ginger-garlic paste, chopped onions, and masalas.
3. To this add chopped tomatoes and cook till soft.
4. Then throw in the scrambled eggs and combine everything. Serve with bread and enjoy!

title: Malai Santra Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Take hung yogurt in a bowl, add all the above ingredients and mix well.

2. Divide into equal portions. Now, stuff with orange marmalade. Damp your hands, take a portion of the mixture, and roll lightly in shape of kebab (one centimeter thick round). Prepare the other kebabs in the same way.
3. Heat sufficient oil in a pan and grill the kebabs till golden in colour.
4. Remove from heat and serve hot with mint chutney or sauce.

title: Dahi Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl and add some curd in it. To this add chopped cucumber, tomatoes, capsicum and onion.
2. Now throw in red chilli, chaat masala, salt and pepper as per taste. Combine all these well.
3. Then place the prepared mix in middle of two pieces of breads.
4. Pan fry it from both the sides and enjoy!

title: Quiche Vegetarienne Recipe

ingredient.description: Pinch of Salt and mixed herbs

method: 1. Slice the vegetables and set aside.
2. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and a tablespoon of the butter in a saucepan.
3. Add the sliced vegetables and sauté over medium-low heat for 10-15 mins. To make quiche sauce, in a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs, cream, milk, salt & pepper.
1. Cream the butter in a mixing bowl. Add flour, salt and mix at slow speed.
2. Add cold water and mix until the dough is formed. Refrigerate the dough for a couple of hours.
3. Roll out the dough on a light floured surface, cut out the discs according to the size of the mould.
1. Take the prepared quiche ring and spread the grated cheddar at the bottom. Fill in ½ of the ring with the sautéed vegetables.
2. And top up the quiche with the cream sauce. Bake at 180 degrees for 30-35 minutes.

title: Aloo Momos Recipe
method: 1. Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
2. Mash together boiled potatos, garlic chives, pepper and salt. The filling is ready.
3. Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
4. Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center. Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
5. Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

title: Egg Cutlet Recipe
method: 1. Heat some coconut oil in a pan and into this, add onion, ginger, garlic, green chillies and curry leaves. Stir well. Add salt and mix well.
2. Next, add powdered pepper and garam masala. Continue to stir. You may now remove the ingredients into a bowl.
3. Cut the steamed eggs into equal halves and remove the yolk.

4. Next, take the cooked potatoes and egg yolk and mix them well with the ingredients already cooked and transferred to the bowl. Also add few coriander leaves and some salt. Knead them well with your fingers.
5. Once the ingredients take the form of a paste, make small balls out of it, which are actually the fillings and keep them aside. Once you have made enough filings, place them inside the egg white.

6. Next, take a saucepan and heat some coconut oil. Now take out the raw yolk from an egg and into it add some turmeric powder and red chilli powder. Add some salt and mix well. You may now take one by one the egg white with the filling and dip them in this mixture.
7. After this have them rolled up in powdered bread crumbs and gently place them in the heated oil. Gently turn the pieces till they turn golden brown.

title: Bombay Style Aloo Recipe
method: 1. Take baby potatoes and pan fry them to make them crisp.
2. Now in a pan add oil and throw in ginger and garlic. To this add slit green chillies and finely chopped onion. Cook till onions are soft.
3. Next add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, jeera powder, coriander powder and salt as per taste. Let it cook for a while.
4. Add a bit of water so and throw in the crispy potatoes.
5. Mix and coat the potatoes with masalas.
6. Serve and enjoy!

title: Sweet Bonda Recipe
method: 1. Mix wheat flour, rice flour, cardamom, baking soda and salt. Combine these well. Now in this strain some boiled jaggery water and mix again.
2. Next, take the banana, mash it and combine in the bowl.
3. The batter of this sweet bonda should be thick so it can be turned into small balls.
4. Once the batter is ready, take handful of these and drop them in oil to fry.
5. Take it out and coat cinnamon and powdered sugar from the top.

title: Sabudana Bonda Recipe
method: 1. To make this dish first, take sabudana and add buttermilk, salt, chilli and giner to it and let it rest overnight to soak in the flavour.
2. Drain the excess liquid and now add rice flour, coriander, coconut powder and form semi soft dough.
3. Form small laddoos out of this dough and deep fry them. Fry till golden brown.
4. Once done enjoy it with a cup of chai.

title: Honey Chilli Chicken Recipe
method: 1. To make this dish, firstly coat chicken pieces with maida and spices and dip them in a cornflour slurry to fry.
2. Now, in a pan add ginger garlic paste, onions and capsicum.
3. To this add, soy sauce, vinegar, chilli sauce, tomato sauce and honey.
4. Mix again. Now throw in the fried chicken pieces and combine with sauce.
5. Let it cook for five minutes on low to medium flame. Once done serve and enjoy!

title: Baked Chicken Wings Recipe
method: 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. Combine the olive oil, garlic, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large, resealable bag; seal and shake to combine.
3. Add the chicken wings; reseal and shake to coat. Arrange the chicken wings on a baking sheet.
4. Cook the wings in the preheated oven 1 hour, or until crisp and cooked through.

title: Idli Tikki Recipe
method: 1. To make this, first, take prepared idlis and mash them in a bowl.
2. To this, add mashed potatoes, chopped veggies like carrot, capsicum and peas.
3. Now throw in the red chilli powder, pepper, coriander powder, haldi powder and salt according to taste.
4. Mix these well.
5. Then form small tikkis from this dough and pan fry them till crispy and golden brown.
6. Once done, you can add a tadka of curry leaves and mustard seeds from the top and enjoy!

title: Veg Galouti Kebab Recipe
method: 1. To make this dish first take, ginger garlic paste, chopped green chillies, cashew paste, salt and mashed boiled rajma.
2. To this add a corse mixture of hard spices like cloves, cardamom stick, black peppercorn and coriander seeds.
3. Combine them well and form small tikkis out of it.
4. Now take some oil in a pan and cook these kebabs till golden brown.

title: Chicken Hot Dog Recipe
method: 1. Slightly toss the chicken sausage in boiling water for 2 minutes. Meanwhile cut the hot dog bun in half lengthwise from the top and warm it a bit.
2. Heat the hot plate, pour oil and grill the sausage. Fry French fries separately, till golden brown in colour.
3. Apply mayonnaise and English mustard on a bun and arrange the sausage in between and then top up with French fries and sprinkle chilli powder on top. Then garnish with cheese.
4. Serve and enjoy!

title: Bread Chilla Recipe

ingredient.description: Salt and pepper according to taste

method: 1. Take a bowl and mix besan, red chilli powder, pepper and salt as per taste.
2. Now finely chop leftover veggies like onion, capsicum, tomatoes, carrots and add them to the dry mix.
3. Now add some water in the bowl and combine all of them. Make sure that the consistency of the batter is flowy.
4. Now, take a bread and dunk it in the besan batter.
5. Head some oil on a pan and cook the bread from both the sides. Once it is golden brown, serve and enjoy.

title: Soya 65 Recipe
method: 1. Boil some soya chunks and then squeeze out excess water. Now fry them by corn flour.
2. Now, in a separate pan add some oil, throw in the fried soya chunks.
3. To this add red chilli powder, pepper, soy sauce, chilli sauce, little vinegar and salt as per taste and mix well. Make sure all the chunks are covered with the sauces.
4. Now add roughly chopped onions and capsicum. Stir again.
5. Garnish with green onions and serve.

title: Potato Smiley Recipe
method: 1. In a large mixing bowl take 2 cups boiled and grated potato.
2. Then add ¼ cup breadcrumbs, 2 tbsp corn flour, ½ tsp chilli powder and salt to taste.
3. Combine all the ingredients well, add more breadcrumbs if required.
4. Form a soft non sticky dough. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes, this prevents smiley from breaking in oil and retain its shape.
5. Now take a large ball sized prepared potato dough and flatten slightly thick over butter paper. Butter paper avoids from dough to stick.
6. Cut round using a cookie cutter or a glass. Use a straw make eyes and use spoon to make a smile.
7. Deep fry the potato smiles in hot oil. Or, brush with oil and bake in preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius for 25 minutes or till it turns golden and crisp.
8. Stir occasionally and fry till golden brown, keeping the flame on medium.
9. Finally, serve potato smiles or potato smiley with tomato sauce or eggless mayonnaise.

title: Pizza Burger Recipe

ingredient.description: Mixed Herbs Salt as per taste

method: 1. Saute onion and garlic in oil. Add fresh red chilli, capsicum, carrot, red pepper, sweet corn and tomatoes. Cook till they are cooked but a littler crunchy.
2. Marinate paneer in mixed herbs, red chilli flakes, salt, ginger paste and turmeric powder.
3. Pour in pizza sauce in the vegetables and season it with pepper, red chilli flakes. Mix it well. Add the marinated paneer and cook it. The filling is ready.
4. Take the burger bun and cut it into half. Spread mayonnaise on both side. Place the filling and mozzarella cheese and close the burger.
5. Spread some pizza sauce on the top of the closed burger and garnish it mozzarella. Bake the ready burger till the cheese melts. The pizza burger is ready!

title: Chilli Cheese Vada Pav Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half tsp Garlic powder

method: 1. Take a container, add boiled potatoes and mash them properly.
2. Heat oil in a pan and add curry leaves, mustard seeds, garlic, salt and green chillies. Let them splutter.
3. Then add mashed potatoes and mustard powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, lime juice, chickpea flour and sugar. Turn off the flame and keep the aloo mixture aside.
1. Now, add coriander leaves and green chillies to a grinder and then the mixture. Blend the mixture well and keep it aside.

1. In a bowl, add chickpea flour, turmeric powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix everything well. Once done, add water. Mix it again to form the bhajji batter. Lastly, add some drops of hot oil. Mix again.
2. Heat oil in a kadhai, take the potato mixture, dip it in the batter of chickpea flour. Next, fry the vadas until golden brown and then transfer them to a plate.

3. The last step is, slice the vada pav bun and add tamarind chutney and garlic powder. Then place the green chilli vada and sprinkle grated cheese on it. Your Cheese Chili Vada Pav is ready to be served.

title: Vegetarian Shami Kebab Recipe
method: 1. First add boiled chana in a bowl and mash them lightly.
2. To this add boiled mashed potato, red chilli powder, coriander powder, salt, pepper, ginger-garlic paste, a few lemon drops and combine them well.
3. Prepare soft dough. Now make roundels from the dough and flatten in out.
4. Once the kebabs are formed you can pan fry them or deep fry them as per your liking!

title: Chicken Keema Bread Roll Recipe
method: 1. In a pan heat some vegetable oil to this add cumin seeds, ginger & garlic paste, one finely chopped onion and salt to taste.
2. Once the Onions are cooked add turmeric, cumin seeds powder and saute it. Put off the flame and leave it to cool.
3. Take bread slices and flatten it with the help of rolling pin.
4. For stuffing, take a large mixing bowl put the sauted onions, mixture of mint leaves, coriander leaves, and chopped green chillies.
5. Add cooked chicken keema, mashed potatoes and one lemon juice. Mix it well.
6. Take a frying pan and fill it with vegetable oil and heat it on a low flame.

title: Homemade Chicken Nuggets Recipe
method: 1. First, cut the chicken breast into chicken strips and then cut it into small pieces.
2. Take a large container, add all-purpose flour and season it with salt and pepper and ginger garlic paste. Mix it well then break the egg into another bowl and whisk until it forms a smooth paste.

3. Then take another bowl and add breadcrumbs then take each chicken strip and dip it firstly in the flour, then into the egg and lastly coat it with breadcrumbs. Repeat it with the remaining chicken strips.
4. Now, heat oil in a pan, deep fry the chicken strips one after another and wait until they turn golden to the perfection.
5. Ps: If you are baking, brush the baking tray with some oil and bake for about 10-15 minutes, turning half-way through.
6. Your homemade chicken nuggets are ready to savour! Pair it up with your favourite dip and enjoy!

title: Ulta Vada Pav Recipe
method: 1. In a pan, heat some oil and add hing, mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, ginger garlic and mix for a while.
2. Once the onions are soft, add haldi, red chilli powder and salt. Mix everything well.
3. Now add the mashed potatoes, coriander leaves and mix everything well. Once done take off the heat and let it cool.
4. Prepare a besan batter by mixing besan, ajwain, salt and haldi with some water in a bowl. Make the batter semi liquidy.
5. For the bread, toast it in butter, once crispy; apply green chutney and garlic chutney on both sides.
6. Cut the bread into small pieces that can fir inside the potato vada.
7. Now take a medium size mashed potato ball and flatten it out in your hand.
8. Place a bread piece in the middle and gently cover it with the potato mixture on all sides until a smooth ball is formed.
9. Dip the potato ball in a besan batter and fry until golden brown.
10. Serve hot and enjoy.

title: Mutton 65 Recipe
method: 1. Mix all the ingredients namely garam masala, chili powder, turmeric, ginger garlic paste, lemon juice and beaten egg with rice flour & corn flour.
2. This will give you your marinade.
3. Smear the marination on the mutton pieces and leave it for about 30 minutes.
4. Fry the chicken in hot oil.
5. Serve with raw onion and lemon wedges.

title: Indian Naan Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. In a pan add some butter, chopped onions, red chilli powder, black pepper powder, chopped chillies and let it mix.
2. Once mixed well, add boiled potatoes, soaked soya and mash them too.
3. You may use some soy sauce and chilli sauce at this point but its optional.
4. Once the mixture is properly combine together, add chaat masala and chopped coriander and take it off the heat.
5. In a pan add some butter and reheat the naan until crisp and hard.
6. Spread on a plate and assemble, spread the mint chutney, then add sliced of tomatoes, cucumber, onions. Sprinkle salt, black pepper, chaat masala and grate cheese on top. Fold and enjoy.
7. For the next sandwich, take the crisp naan and spread some mint chutney, some of the aloo filling and grate some cheese on top, fold and enjoy.

title: Poha Idli Recipe
method: 1. To make this dish, first grind the poha in a powder form. To this, add one cup of curd and combine both.
2. Now add rice rava in batches and keep mixing the batter.
3. Next add salt and water to form a idli batter like consistency.
4. Cover this batter and let it ferment for 30 minutes or until the rava absorbs the water.
5. If the batter looks dry add some more water and mix.
6. Just before cooking, add fruit salt and pour the batter in idli maker.
7. Steam till cooked.

title: Chicken Mayo Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Take a container, add chicken pieces, ginger garlic paste, salt and pepper. Mix everything well.
2. Then take a slice of bread and put it on the worktop. Now, put generous amount of chicken and mayo mixture and spready evenly.
3. Take another bread slice and cover the mixture with it.
4. Remove the edges and cut the sandwich into triangular shape.
5. Serve with some finger chips and enjoy!

title: Mumbai Style Chicken Frankie Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl take maida, add a little salt, some oil and knead a soft and sticky dough by gradually adding water.
2. Pour 2-3 tbsp oil on top of the dough and let it rest for some time.
3. Around the same time, take half of the vinegar and add 4 chopped green chillies to it. Let this sit until needed.
4. For the chicken filling, In a bowl, add the boneless chicken, 1 tsp vinegar, a pinch of salt, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, ½ tsp red chilli powder and ½ tsp black pepper powder.
5. Mix everything well and let the chicken marinate for 15-30 minutes.
6. Now in a pan, heat oil and add half of the onions, remaining ginger garlic paste and let it cook until onions are soft.
7. Now add the remaining dry spices – red chilli powder, black pepper powder, jeera powder, dhania powder, amchur powder, haldi and salt and mix everything together.
8. Once the masalas have been mixed, add the marinated chicken and sprinkle a little water if you feel the masala is too dry.
9. Check if the chicken is soft and cooked, end by adding garam masala and a tspn of vinegar before removing it off the heat.
10. Prepare the cooling green chutney by blending together coriander leaves, mint leaves, ginger, remaining green chilli and a little salt.
11. Now roll a medium-sized thin roti with the dough and cook it in tawa with some oil over medium heat.
12. In a bowl beat the eggs with a pinch of salt and pour this on top of the almost cooked rotis.
13. Once the egg has cooked, remove the roti from the heat, add the chicken filling, garnish with some onion slices, green chutney, the vinegar chillies and roll tightly in a foil before you serve.

title: Desi Masala Poached Eggs Recipe
method: 1. In a small round pan heat some oil.
2. Add a little chopped onion, coriander, chilies, and the dried spices and gently mix.
3. After a minute, crack an egg on top of this.
4. Make sure the flame is on low or medium. After a minute, flip the egg on the other side (Optional).
5. Now flip it back in 10-15 seconds and take off the heat and serve hot.

title: Low carb Kachori Recipe

ingredient.description: Pinch of baking soda and baking powder

method: 1. To make this dish first take some almond flour in a bowl and mix it with ghee to form a crumbly texture.
2. Now add salt, baking soda and baking powder and combine again.
3. Next add psyillum husk to this mix. Prepare dough by adding water.
4. For the filling take moth, soaked chana dal and dry fruits.
5. Toss this with light masalas. Now roll the dough and add this stuffing. Bake it till its light brown in colour.

title: Nuchinunde dumplings Recipe
method: 1. Take toor dal and chana dal, soak them for some time and blend it with some water. Make sure that a coarse texture is formed.
2. Put this mix in a large bowl and coconut, curry leaves, coriander, ginger, cumin, heeng, chilli and salt as per taste. Combine these together.
3. Now shape these dumplings in a cylindrical shape and put it in the steamer.
4. Steam for about 20 minutes and serve.

title: Rajma Patty Burger Recipe
method: 1. Take the boiled rajma, potatoes, peas and small bread pieces. Combine this with masalas and mix.
2. Give it the shape of Tikki and dip the Tikki in cornflour slurry and bread crumbs. Pan fry this till golden brown.
3. Then take the buns and lightly toast them with butter on a pan. Take it out and assemble your burger
4. Now first, add a layer of tomato ketchup on one side of the burger, then place the patty, cheese, sliced onion and tomato.
5. From the top, add sauces like mustard sauce, mayonnaise, or any other sauce of your choice.
6. Finally, close the bun, serve it with fries and enjoy!

title: 2 ways Chicken Popper Recipe Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl take chicken pieces, add salt, black pepper, red chilli powder and mix properly.
2. In another bowl, take 2 eggs and beat them. In yet another bowl take the maida.
3. Now take a chicken piece, dip it in maida, then in egg wash and then back in the maida. Shake lightly and place on a plate.
4. Once all of your chicken pieces are coated, deep fry them in oil until golden brown.
5. Take them off the heat and divide them into two parts
6. In a pan add 1 tbsp. butter, 1 tbsp. chopped garlic and coriander. Toss the chicken and lightly mix everything together.
7. Just as you are getting done, add grated cheese or powdered cheese and mix well.
8. Take off the heat and serve the cheesy garlic chicken popper with a cheesy dip on the side.
9. In another pan add 2 tbspn honey, 1 tspn soy sauce, 1tbspn chilli sauce and toss the chicken in.
10. Mix until the chicken is well coated with the sauces, sprinkle white sesame and your honey chilli chicken popper is ready.

title: Crunchy Egg Fingers Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl take 4 eggs, add salt, red chilli powder, pepper, onions and coriander and whisk well.
2. Transfer this to a heat safe bowl to steam in a cup of water.
3. Once done, take it out and cut it into desired sizes.
4. In another bowl add the maida, Italian seasoning, some salt and pepper and mix well.
5. In another bowl crack and egg and 2 tspn milk to make a liquidy egg wash.
6. Spread the breadcrumbs in a plate. Now take the cut egg piece, coat it with the maida mixture, dip in the egg wash and then coat it with breadcrumbs.
7. Repeat this process until all the egg fingers are coated properly.
8. Heat oil and deep fry the egg fingers until golden brown.
9. Serve along morning or evening tea.

title: Cucumber Idli Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl grate the cucumber and squeeze out all the water and save some of it.
2. Now in another bowl, add the grated cucumber, suji, chopped coriander, chili, coconut and salt and mix well.
3. You may also add a tadka of mustard seeds and curry leaves at this point but that is totally optional.
4. Now add the little bit of cucumber juice you had saved and plain water to achieve the Idli batter consistency.
5. The batter should not be too watery since the cucumber will leave some more water later.
6. Now place your steamer on the gas, add the cucumber batter to the idli tray, and let it steam for 20 minutes or so.
7. Remove from heat and serve hot.

title: Chicken Dynamite Recipe

ingredient.description: Salt and pepper according to taste.

method: 1. Cut your chicken in small pieces, then marinate it with garlic, ginger, red chilli powder, soy sauce and salt as per taste.
2. Let it rest for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl mix, plain flour, corn flour, salt and pepper for the dry batter. And whisk two eggs in a separate bowl.
3. Take the chicken pieces then first dip it in the batter, then in eggs and again batter. Repeat the process with all the pieces.
4. Fry till crisp and golden brown. For the sauce, mix mayonnaise, sriracha sauce, ketchup, honey, lemon juice and red chilli powder together.
5. Mix the fried chicken with the sauce and serve hot!

title: Breadless Cucumber Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Cut both ends off each cucumber. Use a spoon to scoop out the seeds. Then, cut in half to make them half the length.
2. Spread a teaspoon of mayonnaise inside each cucumber cavity.
3. Top one side of the cucumber with lettuce, tomato slices, a cheese slice folded in half, and 2 chicken salami slices.
4. Roll a 3rd chicken salami slice and place into a second empty cucumber boat, so that it fits in there. Close the second half over the first.
5. Repeat with the remaining cucumbers, making 2 cucumber sandwiches total.

title: Hariyali Chicken Tikka Recipe
method: 1. In a grinder take coriander leaves, mint leaves, chilies, ginger garlic, and little water to make a fine paste.
2. Transfer this paste to a bowl, add the curd and all other dry spices and mix everything well.
3. Now add the chicken chunks and mix well, coating every single piece with the marinade.
4. Let this sit for a minimum of 30 minutes.
5. In a pan add a tbspn of oil/butter and roast these chicken chunks on a low flame until they are slightly charred on the edges.
6. You can also bake it or cook it in a tandoor.
7. Take off the heat, garnish with onions strands and munch away.

title: Dhokla Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl and mix sooji, curd, green chillies, salt, turmeric powder, and lemon juice. Mix this well and form a batter.
2. Then grease a pan and pour the batter into it. Steam till dhokla is formed.
3. Once it is done, top it with a tadka of curry leaves, mustard seeds and heeng.
4. For the filling of the sandwich take one piece of tomato, shredded paneer, capsicum and onion.
5. Toss it in spices of your choice.
6. Then take 2 pieces of dhokla, add a layer of green chutney on one side and imly chutney on another.
7. Add the filling in between and garnish it with bhujia to enjoy!

title: Homemade Masala Pav Recipe
method: 1. In a pan heat tbsp. butter, add the ginger garlic chili paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
2. Now add onions, tomatoes and capsciums in intervals of 1-2 minutes. Keep stirring to ensure it doesn’t burn.
3. Add the dry spices like red chili powder, pav bhaaji masala, haldi and salt.
4. Now add almost ½ cup water to let all the ingredients cook properly.
5. Once the water has dried and the masala has no liquid left, take it to the side of the pan and make enough space to toast 2 buns.
6. Cut the buns in the middle as you would for pav bhaaji or vada pav.
7. In the pan, put some butter and let it melt; toast the buns on both sides.
8. Once toasted, spread a spoonful of masala on the bun.
9. Repeat this process until all the masala has been used, garnish with onions, coriander, and drizzle some lemon and enjoy.

title: Bubble Chocolate Recipe
method: 1. Grate the chocolate to get chocolate shavings.
2. In a pan, add sugar and keep it on medium flame. Add the water to the pan and mix it till the sugar is dissolved.
3. When the sugar syrup starts to bubble, add citric acid and coffee. Mix it well.
4. Now add chocolate shavings to the pan and mix till the chocolate melts. Add baking soda and mix well.
5. Whisk the chocolate mixture till it forms a smooth mixture. This will incorporate more air into it. The chocolate mixture will become fluffy and lot of bubbles will appear at this stage.
6. Get the mixture off the flame and pour it into a silicone mould.
7. Place the chocolate filled mould till it sets.
8. Remove the chocolate from the mould and bubble chocolate is ready!

title: Soya Chaap Roll Recipe
method: 1. First take a stick of soya chaap and cut it in small pieces. Fry these in a pan.
2. Once done, add them to a bowl and marinate with curd and masalas of your choice. Keep aside for at least half an hour.
3. Till then mix maida and wheat and form dough. Roll the dough out and bake it on a pan till light golden brown.
4. After marination, fry the soya pieces in a pan till completely cooked.
5. Now take the prepared paratha and add the soya chaap on it, top it with green chutney, spicy red chutney, onions and chaat masala.
6. Cover this in a shape of roll and enjoy!

title: Vegetable Cheese Chilla Recipe
method: 1. First take three tablespoons of besan and add it in a bowl, now mix red chilli powder, pepper and salt according to taste.
2. In this same bow add vegetables like chopped onion, capsicum and tomatoes.
3. Pour some water and make a batter.
4. Once done, pour the batter on a hot pan and cook till both sides turn golden brown.
5. Add cheese to one side and cook till cheese melts.

title: Poha Medu Vada Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl take the poha and wash it, drain almost all the water and let this sit for some time.
2. Meanwhile chop all your ingredients, this will give time to your poha to soak.
3. Now in the bowl of poha, add a little curd and start mashing, add more curd until a soft dough has been formed.
4. You can add a little rice powder or suji if the dough is too watery.
5. Now add all the remaining ingredients and give it a good mix.
6. Make medium-sized round flat discs and then poke holes in the middle with your finger.
7. Once you have made all the vadas, heat some oil, and deep fry them one by one until golden.
8. Don’t keep the vada for too long, serve hot and with green chutney or coconut chutney.

title: Aloo Suji Idli Recipe
method: 1. Take some suji and curd, mix it well and leave it to ferment for two hours.
2. Till then mash some boiled potatoes and add masalas like red chilli, turmeric, green chilli, and salt as per taste. Combine the aloo masala and let it cool.
3. Once the idli batter ferments, add some fruit salt and mix immediately.
4. Then pour this batter into the idli steamer, only fill half of the dish and then add the prepared aloo masala in between.
5. Add some more idli batter from top and cover. Let it steam till the idlis are cooked.
6. Serve and enjoy!

title: Chicken Masala Chops Recipe
method: 1. In a pan heat ghee, add the onions and cook until they brown a little.
2. Add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
3. Now add the dry spices, red chilli powder, haldi, garam masala, salt and mix well.
4. You can increase or decrease the red chilli powder according to your preference, but usually the dish is spicy.
5. Mix all the masalas well and now add the chicken.
6. Keep stirring in high heat for a little while. Once everything is mixed well, cover with a lid and cook on a low flame for 30 minutes.
7. After 30 mins, check if the chicken is cooked, if yes then turn off the heat.
8. No add lemon juice and fresh coriander and serve hot.

title: BLT Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain the bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate.
2. Arrange the cooked bacon, lettuce, and tomato slices on one slice of bread.
3. Spread one side of remaining bread slice with the mayonnaise. Bring the two pieces together to make a sandwich.

title: Butter Chicken Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Wash chicken and cut it into small pieces.
2. Take a large container and add chicken pieces, curd along with all the dry spices. Coat the chicken pieces with marinade properly.
3. Keep it aside for 10-15 minutes. Once done, put it in the skewers and tandoor until tender. If you do not have tandoor then roast the tikkas in the oven.
4. Now mix the pieces with butter chicken gravy.
5. Enjoy the aromatic fiery tikkas with a mint and curd chutney and some onion slices.

title: Rice Paper Veggie Wraps With Protein Recipe

ingredient.description: cup Alfa-alfa or steamed regular sprouts

method: 1. Saute all vegetables then add sprouts and sauces. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes. Once done, add paneer/tofu.
2. Fill a large bowl with lukewarm water, dip a sheet of rice paper and remove immediately.
3. Now, pat off excess water and lay the sheet down on a cutting board or any flat surface. Put a lettuce leaf and fill the centre with saute vegetables and paneer/tofu.
4. Wrap up the burrito and place it on a plate.
5. Repeat the same process with the remaining sheet.
6. Eat with green chutney or hummus for extra protein.

title: Keto Samosa Recipe
method: 1. Take a large container, add almond flour, salt and cumin powder along with lukewarm water. Mix well and knead a dough.
2. Once done, set it aside for a few minutes.
1. Preheat a pan and add butter (preferably grass-fed), then add ginger, cauliflower, onion along with all the spices. Mix well and stir fry for 5-6 minutes.
1. Now, take a small portion from the dough and roll it out, fill it with the stuffing and bake for 14-15 minutes or until golden brown.
2. Follow the same process for all the samosas.
3. Serve and enjoy!

title: Schezwan Style Chilli Potatoes Recipe
method: 1. First peel and cut your potatoes in a long shape. Then add cornflour to it and fry them till cripsy.
2. In a separate pan then add, some oil, soy sauce, chill sauce, vinegar and mix these well.
3. Then add the chopped vegetables and make a slurry from cornflour. Mix this and then throw in your potatoes.
4. Now add some Schezwan sauce from the top and combine again.
5. Let it cook on low flame for a while. Then serve in a bowl and garnish with spring onions.

title: Momo Manchurian Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a saucepan and add ginger garlic paste along with all the sauces and let it simmer for 5-10 minutes.
2. Once done, add all the dry ingredients (spices) along with veggies.
3. Stir fry for about 5 minutes. Now add pan fried momos into the sauce and stir fry again.
4. Cover for 5 minutes. Then pour it on the plate and garnish with cilantro and spring onions.
5. Serve and enjoy

title: Batata vada idli Recipe
method: 1. Prepare idli batter as you would and keep it aside.
2. In a pan heat some oil, add mustard seeds and when they start to crackle add curry leaves, chana dal, ginger and onion.
3. To this add red chilli powder, haldi, salt and mix.
4. Add boiled potatoes and mash properly until a stuffing is formed.
5. Grease the idli pan and pour the batter halfway in every idli bowl, now add a spoonful of potato stuffing and pour batter on top until the idli bowl is filled.
6. Steam this like you would a simple idli and check if cooked in 20-25 mins.
7. Remove from heat and serve with chutney or sambar.

title: Makhana Chikki Recipe
method: 1. Take a cup of roasted makhana and grind it into coarse powder.
2. Grind sunflower and pumpkin seeds too.
3. Grind dates and honey together too.
4. In a bowl mix everything together and add peanut butter and mash with your hands.
5. In a tray or a flat plate, lay the mixture and tap properly.
6. Add crushed nuts for extra crunch.
7. Freeze for some time, cut and serves weight loss friendly makhana chikki.

title: Chilli Cheese Chicken Lollipop Recipe
method: 1. Finely shred basil leaves and put in a bowl. Add chicken mince, salt, tarragon, schezwan sauce, onion and 1¼ cups breadcrumbs and mix well.
2. Divide the mixture into 8 equal portions, stuff each portion with 1 tbsp grated cheese and shape them into a ball. Coat the balls in the remaining breadcrumbs.
3. Deep-fry the chicken balls till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
4. Insert a lollypop stick in each fried ball and serve hot.

title: Egg Fingers Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add eggs, salt, black pepper, and red chili powder.
2. Beat well to create the smooth texture of eggs. Now in an aluminum container (you can add any heat-proof container), pour the beaten eggs.
3. Now in a pan, boil water. Place the egg container in boiling water and cover for 5 minutes until the egg hardens.
4. After 5 minutes, check with knife and take it out if the eggs are fully hard. Then cut the egg in vertical strips or in finger cut.
5. Now one by one coat the egg finger with corn flour then dip in milk and then coat with breadcrumbs.
6. Repeat the step for other fingers. Fry the egg fingers on medium temperature.
7. Take out on kitchen paper to absorb excess oil.
8. Egg fingers are ready to serve.

title: Kolhapuri Kat Vada Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and roast whole spices along with cumin seeds, coriander seeds and poppy seeds.
2. Now add garlic and onion and saute for about 5-6 minutes.
3. Once onion gets translucent, add tomato and sautee until soft and mushy.
4. Then add grated coconut and saute for a few minutes. Let the mixture cool down and then transfer it into the blender.
5. In a large vessel, add oil, hing, mustard seeds, curry leaves, turmeric powder, chilli powder and garam masala.
6. Saute until oil separates from sides. Now add water as required for the gravy, salt and mix everything well.
7. Cover and boil for 10-15 minutes or until oil separates. Now, kat is ready.
1. Heat oil in a pan, add all the dry ingredients mentioned in the ingredients for vada. Except salt.
2. Now add potato along with salt and mix everything well so that they potatoes absorb the flavour of all the spices. Further add lemon juice and coriander leaves.
1. Add besan in a bowl along with rice flour, turmeric, chilli powder, hing and salt. Mix well.
2. Now, add water to form a thick and consistent batter. Add baking soda and mix well again.
3. Take a small ball sized aloo mixture and flatten slightly and then dip in besan batter coating uniformly.
4. Deep fry in hot oil until golden and crispy and once done, drain off over kitchen paper to remove excess oil.
1. Pour a generous amount of kat into the plate or a bowl and then place 2 batata vada in it or more.
2. Garnish with few chopped onion, coriander and sev.
3. Enjoy kat vada recipe as an evening snack.

title: Chilli Cheese Dosa Recipe
method: 1. Blend rice, urad dal and channa dal, salt and some water together in a blender.
2. Grease a non-stick pan with oil, add batter onto it and spread it in a circular motion.
3. Now add chilli flakes and grated cheese on top of the dosa.
4. Wait and let the cheese melt.
5. Serve and enjoy!

title: Keto Upma Recipe
method: 1. Cut cauliflower and blend them in a grinder and form a coarse consistency.
2. Then in a pan add some oil, curry leaves, mustard seeds, green chillies and ginger.
3. Mix these and then add the blended cauliflower, cook on low flame and throw in the spices.
4. Serve it in a bowl and top it with some peanuts.

title: Peanut Sundal Recipe
method: 1. Soak the peanut in water for an hour. Cook this in a pressure cooker for not more than 2 whistles.
2. In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, once they crackle add asafoetida (Hing), curry leaves grated ginger and let it sauté for some time.
3. Now add the peanuts, salt and grated coconut and stir properly.
4. Serve hot and enjoy with tea or with a south Indian meal spread.

title: Chicken Popper Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl take chicken pieces, add salt, black pepper, red chilli powder and mix properly.
2. In another bowl, take 2 eggs and beat them. In yet another bowl take the maida.
3. Now take a chicken piece, dip it in maida, then in then and then back in the maida. Shake lightly and place on a plate.
4. Once all of your chicken pieces are coated, deep fry them in oil until golden brown.
5. Take them off the heat and serve as is with ketchup or mayo or a side of your choice.

title: Chicken Angara Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Take the chicken pieces and marinade in 1 tbspn ginger garlic paste, lime juice, salt and half of the red chilli powder and degi mirch powder. Let this sit for at least 30 mins.

2. For the 2nd marinade, in a bowl take mustard oil, remaining of your red chilli powder and degi mirch powder, and all the dry masalas, along with hung curd and besan. Mix everything well until a smooth creamy paste is formed.
3. Get the chicken and coat properly in the marinade and let this sit for another 15 minimum.
4. The tikka is ready to be cooked, place it in skewers and roast on the tandoor.
5. Enjoy the aromatic fiery tikkas with a mint and curd chutney and some onion slices.

title: Tawa Bread Rolls Recipe
method: 1. Take a few slices of bread, cut their edges and roll them out.
2. For the stuffing of these rolls, mash some boiled potatoes and add vegetables like onion, carrots and beans.
3. Throw in masalas like red chilli powder, pepper, coriander powder and salt according to taste.
4. Mix these well and fill the bread with this stuffing.
5. Roll up the bread and close it with cornflour slurry.
6. Pan fry these on a tawa. Once golden brown take these out.
7. Serve and enjoy with your favourite dip.

title: Crispy Cabbage Pizza Recipe
method: 1. Slice cabbage and soak in white vinegar and water keep aside.
2. Drain cabbage and dry with cloth and pour egg and maze flour on it.
3. Now, chop onion, coriander, and dice red pepper.
4. Beat whole egg and keep aside.
1. Heat non-stick pan add little oil when hot, add cabbage and cook on slow fire.
2. Cover with lid and cook till golden brown from one side.
3. Put plate on top of the pan and turn the side.
4. Spread tomato paste on cooked side of cabbage and sprinkle chopped onion, Chopped coriander and mozzarella cheese.
5. Spread sliced mushroom, chopped coriander and red pepper on top and cover with lid. Cook till cheese melts.
6. Remove from pan and cut with pizza cutter and serve hot.

title: Chicken Sub Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Slice the bread into half, keep aside. Tear the lettuce leaves using your hands and keep aside.
2. Place the following on one half of the bread according to the given order: cheese slice, lettuce leaves, tomatoes, onion and chicken pieces.
3. Drizzle with mustard, mint mayo and sweet chilli sauce. Place the other half of the bread on top.
4. The sub sandwich is ready! You can little toast it in the oven if you want a crispy bread layer.

title: Cheeni Toast Recipe
method: 1. To make this first take two slices of bread and spread some ghee on it.
2. After that, add some sugar as per your taste.
3. Close the two bread together and grill it either in a toaster or a pan.
4. Once the sugar starts caramelizing and the bread turns golden brown, take it out on a plate and enjoy.

title: Turai Pakoda Recipe
method: 1. Thinly slice turai, sprinkle some salt on it and let it sit.
2. For the batter, in a bowl add besan, rice flour, dry masalas, chopped coriander and mix. To this add water in batches; make sure the batter is runny but not very liquidy.
3. Now drench all the excess water from the turai and tap it dry.
4. Dip the turai slices in the batter one by one and fry until golden brown on both sides.
5. Serve hot with ketchup or any chutney of your choice.

title: No bread sooji toast Recipe
method: 1. Prepare the sooji ghol by mixing sooji, curd, some water and salt.
2. Then in a pan add chopped onion, carrots, tomatoes and capsicum. Mix these with masalas and sautee for a few minutes.
3. Then in another pan, pour some sooji batter, in middle add the vegetable mix and pour the morr batter from above.
4. Cook this well and serve with any chutney or sauce and enjoy!

title: Makhana Bhel Recipe Recipe
method: 1. Take potatoes, green chillies, chopped coriander, jeera powder, black pepper, salt and lemon juice in a bowl.
2. Mix everything together.
3. Add makhana and peanuts, give a final mix and serve.
4. You may also garnish with some pomegranate seeds.

title: Sooji Pakoda Recipe
method: 1. Take a large bowl and add sooji, curd, water and mix well until it forms a thick and consistent batter.
2. Now add sliced onion, chopped coriander leaves along with chopped ginger, cumin seeds, baking soda, salt, red chilli powder and chopped green chillies. Mix well again.
3. Heat oil in pan and drop in small portions from the batter into the pan for deep frying.
4. Fry till golden brown.
5. Serve with mint chutney and steaming cup of tea. Enjoy the perfect monsoon snack.

title: Idra/ White Dhokla Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl wash and soak rice, fenugreek and flattened rice for 5-6 hours. In another bowl wash and soak only dal for the same time.
2. Once soaked properly, make a smooth batter separately.
3. Mix both the batters in a bowl and let it sit overnight in a warm place.
4. Once it has fermented overnight, add salt, ginger chilli paste and mix properly.
5. Ready the dhokla pan by greasing it with some oil.
6. Just before pouring the batter in the dhokla pan, add the fruit salt, mix well and then pour it on the dhokla pan.
7. Lightly tap so the batter is evenly distributed, now sprinkle some red chilli powder and black pepper powder on the batter and then let it steam for 20-25 mins.
8. Once done, take out the idra and let it cool.
9. While it cools, prepare the tadka. In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and once it starts to crackle add hing and curry leaves. Take off the heat in a minute and pour on the idra evenly.
10. Cut into square pieces and serve with garlic chutney, dhaniya chutney or a side of your choice.

title: Lamb Sambousek Recipe
method: 1. Mix the flour and salt in a bowl add the oil and water and continue to mix.
2. Divide the dough into small equal balls. Roll out onto a smooth floured surface and cut into circles of about 1/2 cm thick.
3. Cook the minced lamb meat in a pan over medium heat until brown, break down chunks of meat with a wooden spoon and drain off any excess fat.
4. Add the onion, oil, spices, salt and cinnamon powder and stir continuously for 5 minutes.
5. Remove from heat and cool aside.
6. Then stuff the meat inside the sheet and fold like a half moon.
7. Deep fry at 175 degree Celsius.
8. Serve and enjoy!

title: Cheese Rakakat Recipe

ingredient.description: oz Kashakawan cheese (shredded or cut into 2-inch-long pieces)
Canola or Vegetable Oil for frying
Water or egg wash for sealing

method: 1. For the filling, take a bowl and shred the cheese or cut into 2 long inches long pieces that are no thicker than your fingers (It is preferred to shred the cheese).
2. Add toasted sesame seeds and fresh herbs like chopped parsley or mint to the mixture.
3. If parsley or mint are not available, one can use dried mint. If you are using dried mint, use only 1 tsp. instead of 1 tbsp. of freshly chopped mint.
4. Mix the mixture thoroughly and pour it inside the spring roll sheets.
5. Wrap and the seal the edges of the roll with either egg wash or just water.
6. Now, heat the oil to medium-high heat and fry the prepared rolls just until golden.

7. If you prefer baking, you can place the rolls on a non-stick pan, brush each side of the roll generously with some oil or spray it, then bake in the oven on 400 degree for 15-20 minutes (turning it over half way) until both sides are nice and golden.

title: Bhaaji vada Recipe
method: 1. Mix chopped palak, methi, onions, ginger, garlic and green chillies in a bowl.
2. To this add besan, jeera powder, dhaniya powder, and salt as required.
3. Add minimum or no water as the mixture will also leave some moisture.
4. Mix properly and form soft mix.
5. Take medium sized balls of this mix and fry for 2 mins. Remove from oil and let it cool.
6. Once cooled, take these balls and press them in your palm to make flat vadas.
7. Fry these again for 2 mins for that extra crunch and serve hot.

title: Maggi Manchurian Recipe
method: 1. First, cook maggi as you generally would. Once the water has dried take it off in another bowl.

2. To the maggi add chopped onions, cabbage, carrots, half of your ginger garlic, and salt. After everything is well combined, add cornflour and make a mixture with light hands, don’t mash it too much.
3. Once the mixture is prepared, grease your hands and make tiny balls out of it. Fry these balls in medium heat.
4. In another pan, heat some oil and add remaining ginger-garlic, spring onions, diced onions and capsicum. Stir fry this for a minute.
5. Now add tomato sauce, chilli sauce, soy sauce, salt and pepper. Let the sauces cook for 2-3 mins.
6. Make cornflour slurry by mixing 2 tbspn cornflour and half cup water. Add the slurry to your pan and let it thicken.
7. You can add some water to adjust the consistency of the gravy.
8. Finally, add the fried noodle balls and garnish with spring onions. Your maggi manchurian is ready!

title: Schezwan paneer Recipe
method: 1. Soak Dried red chillies in water for 10 mins then grind coarsely.
2. In a bowl, add cornflour, some salt, 1tspn black pepper, water and prepare a slurry to marinate paneer for atleast 10 mins.
3. After 10 mins shallow fry the paneer and keep it aside. Don’t throw the marinade, we will need this for the gravy.
4. In a pan heat some oil, add chopped ginger garlic and sautee for a while.
5. Add spring onions, Chilly paste and schezwan peppercorns and let it cook for some time.
6. To the chilli paste, add vinegar and soy sauce according to your liking. Then cook until the masala leaves some oil on the sides.
7. Add diced onions and Capsicum and stir.
8. Get the remaining marinade, add water to it and add this to the pan. Let is cook and thicken to your desired consistency.
9. Just 2 mins before it reaches your desired consistency, toss in the paneer and adjust salt and pepper according to your liking.
10. Let it simmer for a while and your Schezwan paneer is ready.

title: Bhee ji tikki Recipe
method: 1. Boil the lotus steam and aloo separately until mushy.
2. Once done take them out and mash together.
3. To this add chopped onion, coriander, chilli, aamchur, a pinch of dhaniya nd jeera powder and salt as required. Mix everything and keep it aside.
4. Prepare batter, mix besan, salt, haldi, pinch of jeera powder and dhaniya powder, water and make a semi liquidy batter thick enough to coat the tikki properly.
5. Get your mashed aloo and bhee mixture, make flat oval shape and dip in the batter.
6. Fry until golden brown and serve hot with the chutney of your choice.

title: Sooji Appam Recipe

ingredient.description: Water to make the batter thin

method: 1. You need to first blend rava and poha together.
2. Then mix it with curd, water, sugar and salt according to taste.
3. Fold these together until they combine.
4. Then add fruit salt and whisk the appam batter till a smooth consistency.
5. Pour a ladle full of this batter on a pan and cook till it is lightly brown.
6. Serve along with your favourite curry and relish!

title: Oats and Vegetable Dhokla Recipe

ingredient.description: cup Mixed boiled vegetables (green peas, french beans, carrots)
To garnish chopped coriander and chilli powder

method: 1. In a bowl mix all the ingredients together.
2. Add the Eno fruit salt, mix thoroughly and let the batter froth.
3. Grease a thali with oil.
4. Pour the batter in the thali. Shake the thali till the mixture is evenly spread.
5. Sprinkle the coriander leaves and chilli powder on top.
6. Steam in a steamer for 8 to 9 minutes till the dhoklas are evenly cooked.
1. Cool the cooked dhoklas slightly and cut into pieces.
2. Serve with green coriander chutney.

title: Hariyali Tacos Recipe
method: 1. For our signature green colour, we need to make a puree of palak, half the coriander and pudina and garlic powder or garlic cloves.
2. Now in a bowl take your flour, corn meal, some salt and add this puree.
3. Knead a dough just like you would for your roti.
4. For the filling, if you have an avocado scoop it out and mash it In a bowl.
5. To this, add salt, onion, tomatoes, sprouts and the remaining of your dhaniya and pudina.
6. If you don’t have avocadoes then in a bowl add onion, tomatoes, sprouts, dhaniya, pudina, salt and some mint chutney to give it that desi twist and the green colour.
7. To make taco shells, make tiny rotis out of the dough and cook it on a tawa with some oil. A taco shell and roti look and feel almost the same.
8. Now for the final step, take your taco, put the filling in the middle squeeze some lemon juice on top and enjoy!

title: Olive Bread Recipe
method: 1. Chop your green/black olives and keep them aside.
2. In a small bowl, add the yeast and warm water to activate it, and keep aside for 10 mins.
3. Until then, sift together all your dry ingredients – Flour, salt, garlic powder and herb mix if you are using that.
4. You can simply add chilli flakes and oregano too.
5. Mix all the dry ingredients together then add the yeast and water solution on this. Add half cup water and knead the dough.
6. The dough might feel sticky but don’t stop, once everything is mixed together add the chopped olives and mix that too.
7. Spread a good amount of olive oil on the bowl you are using to mix the dough and drizzle some on the top as well.
8. Now we have to cover and let this dough rest for at least 30 mins, best if you can keep it aside for 2 hours.
9. After 30 mins, take it out. The dough must have doubled in size so gently poke it and let it reduce to its original size.
10. Knead the dough one last time for 4-5 mins and then bake it.
11. Preheat your oven and bake at 400 degree for 20-25 mins until the top is golden.

title: Kathal ke kebab Recipe
method: 1. Soak chana dal for 3-4 hours and cut down the jackfruit into small chunks.
2. After soaking and cutting, boil dal and jackfruit together until more than 80% cooked.
3. Now blend them together along with ginger garlic paste and green chillies in a blender.
4. Add all the seasonings and spices mentioned in the ingredients list with chopped coriander leaves. Mix well by using your hands.
5. Make small and rounded kebabs and shallow fry them on a pan with heated oil.
6. Serve with yogurt, mint chutney and onion rings.

title: Sooji Golgappe Recipe
method: 1. Take the sooji (try to take the thick variant) in a big bowl, add oil and water gradually.
2. Knead it into a smooth dough that should not be too sticky or too tight. Cover the dough, let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
3. Now, pull out small units from the smooth dough and roll them flat (about 2 ½ inch diameter) using a rolling pin.
4. In a wok, heat some oil and start frying the sooji puris one by one. Fry until they puff up and turn golden brown from both ends.
5. Switch off the heat when done. Strain and let it cool and serve!

title: Makki Ka Dhokla Recipe
method: 1. Take a large container and add maize flour, red chilli powder, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, turmeric powder and coriander powder in it.
2. Now add crushed peas, finely chopped green chillies, baking soda and coriander leaves into the mixture.
3. Make a soft dough by slowly adding water in it. keep it aside for 10-15 minutes.
4. Take small portions from the dough and make a circular disc and pierce it in between by using your finger.
5. Now steam the dhoklas for next 10-15 minutes or until they are soft and spongy.
6. Serve it with moong dal and mint chutney.

title: Roadside Kaalan Recipe
method: 1. Chop mushroom and slice the cabbage. keep it aside.
2. Now take a large container and add, maida, corn flour, red chilli powder, salt and turmeric powder. Mix it well and keep it aside for 20-25 minutes.
3. Heat oil in a kadhai and pour small portion of the mixture into the kadhai and deep fry until golden brown.
1. Grind tomatoes and curry leaves along with black pepper, cumin seeds, funnel seeds, cloves and ginger.
2. In a separate pan, add oil and stir fry chopped onions and all the masala powder. Mix well.
3. Now, add the tomato mixture and add water in it. Give it a good boil.
4. Put the pakora inside and cover the pan for 5-6 minutes.
5. Garnish with coriander leaves and enjoy!

title: Almond Millet Mathi & Chilli Yoghurt Dip Recipe

ingredient.description: tsp Crushed dry roasted cumin seed

method: 1. Roast almond in preheated oven at 180-degree celsius for about 4 minutes and cut them roughly, once cooled down.
1. In a bowl, combine greek yoghurt, chopped ginger, chopped green chilli, chopped fresh coriander leaves. Mix well and season the mixture with salt and pepper.

2. In a mixing bowl, combine pearl millet flour, all-purpose flour, almond flour, chopped ginger, chopped green chilli, chopped onion, grated boiled potato, roasted coriander seeds, salt, chaat masala, chopped fresh coriander leaves and roasted almond.
3. Make soft dough and keep aside for 30 minutes to rest.
4. Portion the dough in 15 gm and roll it in 3 inch diameter disk with 1 cm thickness. Now, cook these sheets on medium flame using ghee till golden colour.
5. Serve along with chilli yogurt dip and enjoy.

title: Sanna Pakora Recipe
method: 1. Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl and mix well. (except oil for frying)
2. Make a thick and consistent batter by adjusting the water quantity.
3. Heat oil in the pan and add small portions of the batter into the hot oil and adjust the flame to low medium.
4. Fry the pakora until golden brown.
5. sprinkle some chaat masala and garnish with coriander leaves
6. Serve hot with your favourite chutney

title: Indian Bibimbap Recipe

ingredient.description: To taste Kashmiri red chilli powder

method: 1. To prepare the chicken marinade, combine soy sauce, sesame oil, chopped garlic and sugar.
2. When your chicken is cooked and boiled add the marinade into it and keep it in refrigerator for an hour.
3. Cook your rice.

4. While your rice is boiled, prepare the sauce of the dish. For this you would need tomato, onion, chilli powder, chilli flakes, soy sauce and chopped garlic. Roughly chop the tomatoes and onions and sautee them till they are soft. In a blender add all the ingredients of the sauce and blend till a paste is formed.
5. In a pan add the thinly sliced vegetables and cook them in sesame oil, to this also add the shreds of chicken. Cook both of them together. Throw in your salt and pepper for taste.
6. Lastly, in a bowl put your rice at bottom, add the mix of cooked vegetables and chicken and finally pour the sauce according to your taste.
7. You can choose to top it with fried egg as well. And your Indian bibimbap is ready!

title: Egg kebab Recipe
method: 1. Grate boiled eggs and mix all the ingredients together (except breadcrumbs).
2. Add water as required and knead the egg mixture well by using your hands.
3. Add the seasonings according to your taste and make round shaped kebabs from the mixture. Coat them well with bread crumbs.
4. Heat the oil in deep bottomed pan or kadhai. Deep fry the kebabs.
5. Serve hot with onion rings and mint chutney

title: Tandoori Aloo tikka Recipe
method: 1. Rinse the baby potatoes well and then half boil them.
2. Set aside and let them become warm. After, it peel them.
3. For Marination, take hung curd in a container and add all the spices together. Mix them well.
4. Now add cream and besan. Again, mix very well.
5. Add the potatoes in the curd marination. Mix very well. Cover and allow to marinate for atleast 2 hours.
6. Place the tray in the oven which has been preheated at 250 degrees celsius for 10 to 15 minutes.
7. Grill the aloo tikka at the same temperature of 250 degrees celsius till the potatoes become golden.
8. Put coal in a katori and place it in the centre of the dish and cover the pan for 1-2 minutes.
9. Serve it with mint chutney and onion rings.

title: Almond And Sweet Potato Toast Recipe
method: 1. Roast the almonds with skin in preheated oven at 180 degree celsius for 4 minutes and cut into slivers once it cools down.
2. In a bowl, add dices of roasted sweet potato with salt, pepper, chaat masala, lemon juice, chopped ginger, chopped green chilli, green chutney and mayonnaise. Toss it well to mix evenly.
3. Toast the bread till golden colour.
4. Layer the mix of diced sweet potato over toasted bread and drizzle olive oil over it.
5. Sprinkle the almond slivers on it and serve.

title: Egg Muffins Recipe
method: 1. Whisk together the eggs, spices and vegetables.
2. Fill each muffin tin with three-quarters of the way to the top with the mixture, crumble mozzarella cheese or any cheese over the top.
3. Bake for 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees, until golden brown and cooked through.
4. Serve hot or store for later. Enjoy!

title: Egg Potato Pakoda Recipe Recipe
method: 1. Make a smooth batter of gram flour, corn flour, salt, red chili powder to taste, turmeric powder and half tsp cumin powder.
2. Cut boiled eggs into half. Scoop out egg yolks and mash them. Combine with grated potato.
3. Add salt, red chilli powder, green chilli, half tsp cumin power, chaat masala and garam masala powder to the egg yolk and potato mixture.
4. Scoop back this mixture in the hollow of boiled egg whites. Press firmly.
5. Dip the stuffed eggs in besan batter and fry.

title: Stuffed Tandoori Mushroom (Bharwan Mushroom ) Recipe
method: 1. coat mushroom with flour and Wash them so all the dirt will go off ,separate their stems. Add mushroom stems and cook it till light brown in colour.
2. Chopped very fine onions, ginger, and garlic and mushroom stems.
3. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin (jeera) to it and sauté, now add ginger garlic onion and sauté it till light pinkish colour.
4. Add turmeric powder ,cumin powder and coriander powder and salt to taste once done, Switch off your flame.
5. In one bowl mix curd,lemon , red chilli paste ,mustard oil ,salt and mix well and make a tandoori marination ,
6. Now fill this stuffing in empty space of mushrooms. coat all mushroom with tandoori marination carefully so that the stuffed mix will not come out .

7. Preheat your tandoor ,put mushroom in a skewer and bake it in tandoor , Now everyone will not have tandoor so they can keep mushroom in abaking tray and bake it in the convection oven under grill or bake for apx 15-20 min at 180 C

title: Iron Paffles & Coffee Recipe
method: 1. In a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, mix the flours and salt. Add the butter and mix on low speed until it is fully incorporated and the mixture looks a little crumbly, about 1 minute. Add the water and mix until the dough comes together (4 minutes). Raise the speed to high and mix for 1 minute more, until the dough is smooth.
2. Turn the dough onto a floured work surface and form into a rough rectangular shape. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes.

3. In the same stand mixer bowl-this time fitted with the paddle attachment, mix the butter and flour until combined. Scoop the mixture onto a piece of parchment paper and spread it into a rectangle about ½-inch thick and 6 x 9 inches. Cover and refrigerate–monitor until the Tempe rates reaches about 65°F to 70°F (It should be able to gently bend without breaking).

4. When the dough and butter block are both chilled, but flexible, it’s time to lock the butter inside the dough. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out into a rectangle slightly wider than the butter block, and twice the length (12 x 10 inches). Turn the rectangle so that one of the shorter ends is facing you.

5. • Turn the butter onto the dough, positioning it so that there is a ½-inch margin of dough around the sides and bottom of the butter block. Gently stretch the top portion of the dough to fold it down over the butter block so that it meets the opposite edge of the dough. Press the edges of the dough together firmly all the way around to seal, then fold the excess dough at the bottom and edges under itself. You should now have a firm, but pliable rectangular package of dough (about 6 by 10 inches) enveloping the butter block. If the dough feels soft, refrigerate the dough for 15 to 20 minutes before proceeding. Otherwise, proceed with Fold A.

6. Fold A: On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to a rectangle about ½-inch thick. If you’re having a hard time rolling the dough, it might be to cold-let it stand at room temperature for 5 to 15 minutes. If the dough feels soft or squishy or melty butter is breaking through, it may be too warm, and may need more time in the refrigerator to firm up.

7. • Position the dough so one of the shorter sides is facing you. The first fold is called a “four fold.” Fold the top portion of the dough about three-quarters of the way over the dough. Fold the bottom portion one quarter of the way over the dough so it meets the left edge (it should look like an open book with an off-center spine). Fold the larger side over the smaller side (essentially folding in half), then wrap and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.

8. • Fold B: On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a rectangle about ½-inch thick. The next fold is called a “three fold.” Face the dough so that one of the shorter sides of the rectangle is facing you. Fold the top portion of the dough about on third of the way over the dough. Do the same with the right edge, folding it one third of the way over, resting it on top of the other piece just folded (like the way you’d fold a standard piece of paper to fit into an envelope). Wrap and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.
9. Fold C: Repeat steps 6 through 7 to perform another “four fold.”
10. Fold D: Repeat step 8 to perform another “three fold.”

11. After the final fold, the dough should be tightly wrapped in plastic wrap and refrigerated for at least 12 hours before using (and up to 2 days). For longer storage, it can be frozen for up to 3 months (thaw overnight in the refrigerator before using).

12. For paffles, we recommend rolling out the puff pastry to 1/8” in thickness and cutting the pastry to fit your waffle maker. It should bake for 4-6 minutes, depending on the temperature of your iron.

title: the pancake underground Recipe

ingredient.description: granny smith or other tart apples, julienned

method: 1. Whisk wet ingredients (eggs, buttermilk, and oil/butter) together in a large mixing bowl.
2. Add dry ingredients and whisk until just combined (small lumps are OK; don't over-mix).
3. Ladle batter into waffle maker and cook according to directions.
1. We recommend slicing into small bite-sized strips, seasoning with salt and pepper, and grilling or sautéing until cooked through.
1. Usually, we just kind of eyeball this, but combine approximately 1.5 cups mayo with about 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, a pinch of black pepper, and 1/4 cup sugar and whisk until emulsified.
2. Adjust the vinegar and sugar until you get the balance of sweet and sour you like!
3. Then combine cabbage, apples, and jalapenos in a large mixing bowl with coleslaw dressing until coated completely. Dress to taste and let sit in the fridge for 30 mins for best results.

4. Finally, assemble the sandwich! Layer grilled pork belly strips atop the bottom waffle, then add the slaw on top of that, and top with the top waffle. Serve with a side of maple syrup for sweet and savory dipping.

title: Mix Veg Sizzling Platter Recipe
method: 1. Take all ingredients in a big bowl
2. Smash with hands, knead it to make thick dough
3. Make small tikkis out of the dough
4. Stir fry in non stick pan (use ghee or olive oil)
1. Blend all ingredients in a mixer to make a fine paste.
2. Add water as per preferred consistency and blend again
3. Chutney is ready
1. Take 1 tbspn butter in a pan
2. Add paneer & all veggies and stir fry on high flame for a min till goldenish brown
3. Add salt & pepper
1. Take 1 tbspn butter in a pan.
2. Add chopped onions, celery, garlic & tomatoes and saute on high flame till goldenish brown.
3. Add salt (to taste) and blend everything to make a thin paste

title: Oats Matar Cheela Recipe
method: 1. Overnight soak the rolled oats.
2. Boil the peas for a minute or two.
3. In a chutney grinder, add boiled peas, ginger, garlic, green chilli, ajwain, hing and salt. Grind everything into a paste.
4. Now drain the water and clean the oats well.
5. Coarsely mash the oats and add the peas paste to it. Mix everything together.
6. Now, heat a tawa and grease with some desi ghee on it.
7. Add a spoonful of peas to the tawa and spread it evenly.
8. On medium to low flame, cook each side well till it turns golden brown in colour. Add some ghee on the edges if needed.
9. Serve the cheelas hot with some ketchup by the side.

title: Goli Bajji Recipe
method: 1. In a large bowl take maida, rice flour, baking soda, a pinch of hing and salt. Mix well.
2. Now add buttermilk and mix well with your hands. You can use an egg beater as well.
3. Add curry leaves, green chillies, coriander leaves and ginger. Mix well making sure everything is well combined.
4. Cover and rest for 3 hours for best results. After 3 hours, mix the batter again.
5. Meanwhile heat oil in a wok.
6. Now make small bite-sized balls from the batter.
7. Drop the balls in hot oil keeping the flame on medium.
8. Stir and deep-fry the balls on medium flame.
9. Drain the excess oil from the goli bajjis once it turns golden brown and crisp. Serve crisp and hot with chutney of your choice.

title: Amaranth Bathua Duet With Turmeric Foam Recipe

ingredient.description: A pinch of white pepper powder

method: 1. Blanch spinach, bathua and amaranth separately in boiling water and give it a shock chill.
2. Drain and remove the excess water and finely chop it.
3. Blend oatmeal, gram flour and millets in a food processor.
4. Add all the dry spices and seasoning to the roasted gram flour.
5. Mix one half of the spinach and bathua with one of the roasted gram flour.
6. Mix the other half of the spinach and red amaranth with the remaining half of the roasted gram flour.
7. Make round patties from the above mixtures.
8. Cook the patties on a nonstick pan until golden brown.
9. Pressure blend cream, turmeric and some water to make foam that can be used for garnishing.
10. To plate keep the patties on top of each other, garnish with cress and top it up with foam.

title: Dhora Ra Gotaka Recipe
method: 1. Heat the oil in a pan, add cumin seeds. Now saute onion and green chilli for a minute.
2. Mix red chillies, coriander and turmeric powder in a bowl with water. Cook until the masala is golden reddish in colour.
3. Add gotaka/khumbi and crushed garlic cook well. Sprinkle green coriander on top and serve hot.

title: Bibim Guksu Recipe

ingredient.description: gms dried buckwheat noodles (or soba noodles

method: 1. Boil the noodles in rolling boiling water and drain the noodles. Run some cold water over the noodles to cool them down. Drain.
2. Place the noodles in a large serving bowl and mix all the salad ingredients with Korean sauce. After all the ingredients are put in the bowl, serve.
3. To eat, mix all ingredients well with chopsticks and indulge.

title: Shahi Tirangi Kofta Recipe

ingredient.description: Whiite pepper (5 gm for kofta and 5 gm for the gravy)

method: 1. Boil the spinach and finely chop
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped garlic add chopped spinach and stir till all moisture evaporates.
3. Add the grated cheese and keep aside.
4. Grate the carrot mix with some boiled potato and keep aside.
5. Now grate the paneer, mix boiled potato along with salt, white pepper, chopped green chilly, chopped ginger, garam masala powder and refined flour.
6. Now take a portion of sautéed spinach and form into a ball cover stuff it into a ball of paneer and potato mixture.
7. Cover this ball again with carrot and potato mixture, keep aside.
8. Similarly make the balls of all remaining mixture.
9. Deep fry the koftas/balls in the remaining oil. Dry and keep aside.
1. Soak cashew nuts in water and make a fine paste along with the boiled onions.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add cloves, cinnamon, cardamom and bay leaf and let them crackle for a few seconds.
3. Add the onion and cashew paste along with green chilly paste and cook for 4-5 minutes.
4. Cover the pan if the masala is spluttering too much.
5. Add salt and white pepper powder and cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add 1 cup water and bring the curry to a boil.
7. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add fresh cream and mix well.
8. Add the kofta cut in two just before serving and serve hot.
9. Garnish it with mint leaves or a sprinkle of kalonji seeds.

title: Egg Hakka Noodles Recipe
method: 1. Take water in a pan, add salt and noodles and let it boil for 5-6 minutes on medium flame.
2. Strain the noodles and add 1 tsp oil, mix it well and keep it aside for 10-15 minutes.
3. Break the eggs in a bowl. Add salt and black pepper powder. Mix it well.
4. Make an omelette and cut it into small pieces. You can also make scrambled eggs in the same wok you would use to make noodles.
5. To make noodles, add oil in a wok along with all the vegetables and stir fry them on high flame for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add boiled noodles, vinegar, soya sauce, salt, black pepper, ketchup and chilli sauce to it. Mix everything and cook for about 2 minutes.
7. Now add the cooked egg and spring onions. Stir it well and cook for another minute. Serve hot.

title: Pyaz Kachori Recipe
method: 1. Take a pan. Add oil, crushed coriander seeds and hing. Cook it for 2 minutes at medium flame.
2. Add gram flour, Kashmiri red chilli powder, black salt, chaat masala and garam masala and let it roast for few minutes.
3. Add chopped onions, salt and green chillies. Cook until onions are soft and then add potatoes and mix everything well. Now let the mixture cool down.
4. To the make dough take maida, ajwain, salt and oil. Mix everything well and add water to prepare a medium soft dough. Cover it with wet cloth and let is rest for 1/2 hour.
5. Make equal sized balls out of the dough. Stuff them with the mixture of onion and potatoes and flatten the kachori with hands. Keep it slightly thick so the mixture doesn't spill out while frying.
6. Fry these kachori's at medium-low flame for 10-12 minutes until golden brown.
7. Serve it with imly chutney.

title: Kulle Ki Chaat Recipe

ingredient.description: small green chillies (cut into small pieces)

method: 1. Boil the potato, peel them and cut horizontally into 2 halves.
2. Hollow out the potato from the centre.
3. Fill the hollow with chickpeas,green chillies, pomegranate, ginger julliens, sprinkle salt, rock salt, black chaat masala and lemon juice.

title: Murgh Kali Mirch Ka Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Cream cheese and marinate chicken tikka with cheese, hung curd, salt, red chilli powder, half of the cream, cornflour and all the powdered spices.
2. Keep aside for an hour to let the chicken absorb the flavour of the ingredients.
3. Skewer the chicken tikka in 8 mm skewers and cook in tandoor.
4. Dum cook the chicken in the oven, sprinkle kebab masala and lemon juice.
5. Garnish it with freshly chopped coriander and serve.

title: Murgh Malai Tikka With Mint Chutney Recipe
method: 1. Marinate the chicken in the lemon, garlic and ginger paste for 30 minutes.
2. In a separate bowl mix together the hung curd, cream and whisk well so that there should be no lumps.
3. Now add the mix to the chicken and marinate for few hours or preferably overnight.
4. Pre-heat tandoor and drizzle off the excessive marinade and thread the chicken pieces onto the skewers.
5. Cook in tandoor for about 12-15 minutes, and then baste with butter after every 5mins and cook until the juices run clear and the chicken is cooked through slightly charred around the edges.
6. Take the chicken off the skewers, sprinkle with chaat masala and ghee.
7. Serve with chutney and raw mango bhel.
1. Take garlic, chili, ginger, sugar, and salt in a small chutney jar of a grinder.
2. Grind them until medium coarse consistency.
3. Add coriander leaves, mint leaves, lemon juice and 1 tbsp. of water.
4. Grind until the smooth texture.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe

ingredient.description: ½ cup/ 1 stick plus 2 tbsp unsalted butter at room temperature
cups semi sweet chocolate chips or high quality chocolate chunks from a bar

method: 1. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
2. In a stand mixer with the paddle, cream the butter and both sugars for 2 minutes on medium speed.
3. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl and continue beating until light and fluffy, 2 to 4 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl again.
4. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl.
5. Reduce the mixer speed to low and gradually add the flour mixture until fully incorporated. Be sure not to over-mix.
6. Remove the bowl from the mixer and fold the chocolate chunks with a rubber spatula until just combined.
7. Use one ounce cookie scoop to portion the dough into 24 balls. Place on a baking sheet and chill for at least 30 minutes and upto 24 hours.
8. When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 325° F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

9. Remove the cookies from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for about 10 minutes. Arrange 12 cookies evenly spaced on the baking sheet. Gently press the dough balls to flatten slightly.
10. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes of until lightly golden brown. Let the coookies sit on the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer them to a cooling rack to cool completely.

title: Sable Viennois Recipe
method: 1. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
2. Slowly add in egg whites and vanilla essence.
3. Sift flour and salt and gently fold into mixture.
4. Pipe and bake at 180°C for 12 minutes, depending on size.

title: Kanda Bhaji Recipe
method: 1. Slice the onions thinly and place them in a mixing bowl.
2. Massage the salt into the onions and allow them to rest aside.
3. Add gram flour to the sweating onions.
4. Add walnuts, coriander seeds crushed and green chillies.
5. Massage all of this together till the gram flour moistens and coats every onion slice.
6. Heat oil for deep frying in a pan.
7. Make little clumps and fry on medium flame, fry till they turn crisp and golden brown.
8. Remove the bhaji on absorbent kitchen napkins.
9. Serve hot and crisp with fried green chillies.

title: Sugar Free Modak Recipe
method: 1. Chop all the nuts - cashew nuts, almonds and walnuts finely. Also chop the seedless dates and dry coconut pieces to fine pieces.
2. Dry roast the chopped nuts one by one separately for 1-2 mints taking care that they would not get burnt, remove them and keep aside in a plate.
3. Dry roast coconut pieces until they turn slight brown in colour and remove them aside too. In the same pan add poppy seeds and roast them slightly until they start popping, remove and keep aside.
4. Heat ghee in the same pan and add chopped dates and raisins and fry continuously until it comes together and becomes like a thick mass. This takes 4-5 minutes roughly.
5. Do not leave it unattended as the raisins might get burnt. Switch off and let it cool slightly.

6. Grind the roasted nuts with dry coconut pieces and poppy seeds to a coarse powder in pulse mode. I like the bite of dry fruits, so I do not powder them completely and hence keep them very course. It is your wish to grind them how you want. Remove the mixture aside into a plate.
7. Now add the date-raisin mixture and pulse it in the mixer to get a coarse mixture. Again it is you wish here to grind it smoothly or keep it coarse like I did.
